Title: Director, Global Medical Data Science, Analytics, and Report...
Description:
Site Name: Belgium-Wavre, Singapore - Rochester Park, Singapore - Tuas, UK - London - Brentford
Posted Date: May 27 2020
Could you lead a team of data scientists and data analysts as part of a Global Medical Analytics and Insights team?
We have created a band-new role to help grow our analytical power and speed by designing specific artificial intelligence and machine learning capabilities to help transform data into actionable insights. In your role, you will design and implement data analytics strategies that enhance the ability of our medical teams across all GSK Therapy Areas to identify insights from a variety of data and enable agile, informed decisions and tactics.
This is a key role in a growing and high visibility area within GSK – a great opportunity to deliver some fantastic work and have a huge impact on the organisation.
Key responsibilities include:
Lead a team of Data Scientists and Analysts to discover customer and patient findings/potential insights using advanced analytics techniques such as natural language processing, text analytics, statistical analysis, machine learning, and analytic modeling aligned with and guided by the Global Medical Affairs business priorities and strategies;
Lead the Data Analysts to develop a roadmap and plan to ensure availability of data critical to address key questions aligned with strategic priorities. Provide leadership and guidance for appropriate data governance plan and approach including data accuracy checks and metrics to build confidence with the Data Scientists and other stakeholders in the accuracy and reliability of the data.
Demonstrate advanced experience and expertise in completing and guiding more advanced analytics solutions and plans to maximise findings from unstructured data; Demonstrate usage of multiple feedback sources including Medical voice of customer feedback from customer listening, feedback via surveys and research, forums, online communities, social media/publicly available information, call centre voice and email feedback and medical information requests
Lead the team to translate unstructured data into actionable insights. Conduct text, sentiment and root cause analyses to answer critical Medical business questions and produce data-driven stories that reveal key insights into customer and patient experience, needs, and understanding to determine appropriate Medical opportunities available
Develop team members given methodological and advanced analytics approach expertise with unstructured data analytics; Stay on top of the latest external methods and approaches, current and emerging industry trends, and advanced methods/best practices; Pull through expertise through critical deliverables and work as a “player-coach”.
Ensure that machine learning models are appropriately trained and tuned for accuracy and relevance with analytical findings within the team. Develop team management approaches and demonstrate coaching skills through training and cross sharing for learning and best practice application as appropriate for the TA or asset. Pull through and demonstrate analytics and business acumen through appropriate selection of methods fit for purpose (and appropriate guidance to team members) that reveal customer patterns in the data that may spark additional data analysis or research for deep customer insight
Deliver timely/close to real time strategic, relevant and actionable findings. Establish an analytics road map for Voice of the Customer (VoC) analyses leveraging a wide range of analytical and data visualization tools and resources available to uncover and communicate opportunities; Lead the team to identify early warning signals and opportunities and demonstrate leadership and expertise in pulling through examples to set the bar and show the team what good looks like.
Proactively identify opportunities and apply advanced analytics methods aligned with and guided by priorities; Lead the team to demonstrate organization of complex information, making it relevant, understandable and actionable; Demonstrate analytic curiosity and a desire to understand challenges to contribute to matrix team reviews and strategic discussions for insight discovery; Seek external benchmarks for continuous improvement leadership within the team.
Develop compelling summaries that visualize the data through narrative dashboards to clearly tell a succinct story in easy to understand ways; Focus on the key findings and insights in alignment with stakeholders' goals/business needs with proper validation techniques to build confidence in the results; Craft and tell compelling stories around commonalities and themes found in the VOC data
Partner with the insights leads and other colleagues/stakeholder partners in Medical Analytics, Global Medical Excellence, etc. to ensure appropriate analytics findings are integrated into deliverables for a holistic and comprehensive view; Demonstrate effective communication and drive efficiencies through collaboration and teamwork
Basic Requirements
We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
Master’s degree/PhD in Medical or Applied Quantitative Sciences discipline
Strong experience within quantitative analysis related fields applying analytics and insights for business decisions (research, analytics, forecasting, etc.)
Experienced in healthcare/pharma
Experienced in unstructured data analysis/text analytics/natural language processing and/or machine learning application for critical business decisions using Python, R, etc. and other text analytics tools and platforms
Strong working knowledge of SQL and/or SAS
Good knowledge of database management, data reporting and analytics, data visualization for business consumption, understanding of best practices with data structures for analytics and reporting, data manipulation, database and analytics skills to develop insightful measures for actions and decision making in a business setting
Preferred Requirements
If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:
Experience leading teams – exposure to virtual teams strongly preferred
Strong grasp of what a true insight is and how to uncover an insight
Mastery of relevant analytical concepts and frameworks
Ability to understand and synthesize across multiple types of datasets and findings
Location
Although this position is advertised in the locations above, we are happy to consider applications from any region on its own merit. Please specify your intended location in your application.
Closing Date
End of business – Wednesday 10th June 2020

Title: Research Assistant/Scientist/Senior Scientist
Description:
Esco Ventures X, Singapore
Job Description

Esco Ventures X is incubating exciting new life science and biotech venture companies with first-in-class science addressing unmet medical needs. This position is available for a recently founded biotech company, developing therapeutics for cancer immunotherapy through a proprietary platform technology which enables identification of novel disease targets based on unique biology. The candidate will contribute to development of the platform technology and work closely with the scientific co-founders and management team. The company has a stellar scientific advisory board and is well-capitalized with seed funding to develop first-in-class immunotherapies against cancer.

We are looking for a Research assistant/Scientist/Senior Scientist to join us in this exciting venture. An ideal candidate is one who is independent, technically competent, and able to work efficiently across multiple projects. Individuals with PhD in immunology are preferred.

Responsibilities

Perform independent research work through the design, execution and troubleshoot of experiments
Manage studies performed by contract research organizations
Evaluate and interpret collected data and prepare oral presentations or written reports/ scientific manuscripts/literature for publication. Present data from research work internally and externally.
Contribute to scientific and strategy discussions to achieve R&D milestones
Maintain accurate and detailed documentation of research data, inventories, protocols, maintenance logs, sample processing logs, SOPs etc.
Lab management duties including procurement, maintaining equipment wellbeing by timely scheduling of maintenance/ servicing/ calibration.
Support the continued protection, creation, and expansion of company’s intellectual property.
Perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein.

Job Requirements

Bachelor/Masters degree with several years of research experience or PhD
Experience with immunological experiment or related discipline would be preferred
Extensive experience in cell culture and a wide variety of cell-based assays. Candidate should be familiar with the culture and handling of PBMCs, T lymphocytes isolation, T cell toxicity assays.
General laboratory techniques that include flow cytometry and molecular assays (such as PCR, qPCR, ELISAs, western blot).
Able to manage and ensure smooth operations in the lab.
Able to work in a fast-paced startup environment
Energetic, highly motivated, collaborative

We require the role to start immediately, interested candidates, please submit a CV and cover letter to mayura.wagle@escoventures.com

Title: Scientist
Description:
Position Summary:

As a Scientist within Illumina’s Research and Technology Development team, you will work as part of a multi-disciplinary research team to help create new sequencing methods. You will play an important role in the research and development of sequencing reagents and consumables with the world-class performance, stability and robustness characteristics that our customers require.
You will be responsible for developing cutting edge technologies and related assays by designing and executing experiments, collecting data, performing analysis, drawing conclusions and presenting to key stakeholders.
Primary responsibilities include formulation, assay development, purification and analytical characterization of compounds and enzymes for next generation sequencing.

Tasks & Responsibilities:
Lead innovative new projects in a fast-paced research and technology development environment. Identify, evaluate, plan, and optimize research ideas leading to new methods and chemistries for sequencing
Explore new technologies and identify creative solutions to overcome current limitations
Identify new opportunities for innovative products using the company’s core technologies
Design, implement, analyze and present experiments to demonstrate feasibility of new technology
Be both a strong individual contributor as well as a collaborative team member. Conduct clear and concise communication with colleagues (cross-functional) and supervisors through oral updates, written reports and technical meetings
Preferred Educational Qualifications:
PhD degree in chemistry, biochemistry or materials science with 2+ years of industrial experience
Preferred Skills and Experience:
Experience in formulation science
Industrial experience is highly desirable
Proven track record in innovation and scientific creativity in new materials design, chemistry and formulation science
Experienced in synthetic and analytical techniques for small molecules and protein formulations
Experienced in assay development for enzyme and small molecule assay development
Demonstrated expertise in techniques e.g. chromatographic (e.g. HPLC, LC-MS etc.), calorimetric (e.g. DSC, ITC etc.)
Strong data analysis skills, ability to interpret and draw conclusions quickly from large data sets.
Experience working in cross-functional teams
Excellent laboratory, experimental and organizational skills
Strong team player with proven collaboration, innovation, and openness character traits.
Attention to detail
Ability to communicate effectively
A self-starter, positive, and driven with a “can do” attitude.
Excellent verbal/written communication skills

Title: Assistant Research Engineer
Description:
Help us build open-source tools and technologies that do for legal and qualitative reasoning what the spreadsheet has done for quantitative reasoning. At SMU's research programme in Computational Law, researchers develop open-source languages and libraries to be shared on Github and used by a future generation of web and mobile apps. We have three to five years to accomplish this goal. As a member of the team, you will have the opportunity to participate in software projects.

This involves learning foundational areas of computer science, including data structures, algorithms, programming language theory, and logic; learning how to use third party tools, including editors, IDEs, databases, business process modelling software, programming languages, specification languages; and libraries; evaluating competing software systems for suitability; building infrastructure to enable application development; managing yourself, and managing fellow team members; engaging in product, project, and program management as needed; reading books and consuming such other media forms about software development; writing documentation such as user/developer-facing manuals, tutorials; delivering community support to users and customers; preparing presentations to represent the project before external audiences; and writing user-facing applications throughout the "full stack". Success metrics: You can measure your (external) success in this job by the number and quality of contributions accepted into the research programme's Github repositories. Numerous software development assignments will be available. You can measure (internal) success by how frequently you find yourself in a flow state; by how many new ways of thinking you have mastered; and by how well you can get computers to help you and other people achieve important goals.

Qualifications Self-taught programmers and holders of non-CS qualifications are welcome to apply. The following qualifications are an advantage: You regularly program in at least one programming language. Programming languages include Javascript, Python, Ruby, Clojure, Reason, Scala, Scheme, Common Lisp, Haskell, Ocaml, Elm, and Prolog. You have developed at least one piece of software that somebody else has used.

You are comfortable using the Unix shell or Windows Terminal with WSL. You are able to independently learn technology from books and online courses (though you will be supported when you get stuck if you “ask questions the smart way”, as Eric Raymond and Eric Moen put it.) You have previously asked, or answered, a question on a technical community support forum. You have an account on Github or Gitlab. Other people turn to you for help with technology, and I mean people besides family.

You possess the “5 Personality Traits Every New Programmer Should Have”, according to learntocodewith.me: Patience, Courage, Passion, Creativity, Logic. You also possess the “Three Great Virtues of a Programmer”, according to threevirtues.com: Laziness, Impatience, and Hubris. Learning opportunities During your time with us, you will be exposed to areas of computing that lie beyond web/mobile app development, data science, and machine learning. You will learn to see the world as a computer scientist does – in terms of logics, languages, and libraries – and acquire, on the job, many of the skills on Matt Might’s list of “what every computer science major should know”.

Working with other junior and senior researchers, you will learn technologies and skills which will be valued across a range of future careers. You will be exposed to an on-the-job crash course in computer science that includes Unix development; languages like Javascript/Typescript, Python, and Haskell; model-driven architecture with DMN; open-source culture; and cloud computing. You will get to observe senior engineers at work and learn from them. We work with many of the technologies listed below.

In your cover letter, please list any items where you already possess some familiarity. You are welcome to add new keywords to better represent your skill set. We list these not as hard requirements but as examples of the things you will have the opportunity to learn. Open-Source Software & Open-Standard Infrastructure Engineering: Internet infrastructure · Unix · Raspberry Pi · TCP/IP · HTTP(S) · XML · JSON · Schemas · YAML · Git · Github · REST APIs · RFCs · IETF · StackOverflow · Hacker News · Technical Writing · Developer Relations and Evangelism Software Development: Test-Driven Development · Continuous Integration · Software Project Management · Agile / XP / Scrum · Pair Programming · Literate Programming · Unit Testing · Amazon Web Services · Docker · Full-Stack Development Programming Languages and Frameworks: Javascript · ECMAscript · TypeScript · React · Node · Deno · Python · PHP · Perl · CoffeeScript · PureScript · Elm · Java · Clojure · Scheme · Haskell · OCaml · Common Lisp · Scheme · Unix shell · PowerShell Documentation: ReStructuredText · LaTeX · Jekyll · Markdown · Org-Mode Parsers, Compilers, and Programming Language Theory: Lex/YACC · alex/happy · Bison · CFGs · EBNF · BNFC

Title: Software Architect (Data Science)
Description:
About Yojee
Yojee Limited (ASX: YOJ) is a cloud based (SaaS) logistics platform that seamlessly and uniquely manages, tracks and optimises freight movements along the entire logistics chain, from sender to end customer, across borders and between logistics providers (land, sea, air), with subcontractors and for multi-leg journeys. Rarely is a single carrier servicing an entire goods journey from sender to end customer, or exclusively using one type of transportation method. Yojee ensures connectivity and more efficient planning along the entire journey.

About Department
The backbone of Yojee focused on building the core platform and product using best in class technology. We love clean code, well-designed architecture and applying best practices. We build cool technology that lasts long and scales well.

About the role
Yojee is looking for a Data Scientist to analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve our company and to build data products to extract valuable business insights. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential and having a passion for machine-learning and research.

Duties and Responsibilities

Prototyping faster & more scalable machine learning and heuristic optimisation algorithms using cutting edge research to solve logistics’ problems such as finding the best possible, or cost efficient routes, multi modal route planning, NP-hard problems, etc.
Build and maintain a scalable data pipeline to consume data from multiple sources.
Basic data cleansing and preparation.
Build analysis and visualisation for business purposes and sales pitches.
Build solutions using Big Data technologies to crunch potentially enormous data and respond with meaningful results in real time.

Requirements

Minimum Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or its equivalent related experience.
Minimum 2 years of experience in machine learning and data analysis.
Proficient in software programming and database skills; Python, Scala, Java, SQL, scikit-learn, MapReduce, Spark, Apache Hadoop.
Knowledge of Big Data Frameworks such as Spark, Hadoop, etc.
Proficient and experienced working with statistical models; Regression, Clustering, Classification, etc.
Experience working with agile software development practices.
Ability to work in a globally distributed team.
Singaporeans and PRs are encouraged to apply for this position.

Nice to have

Scikit-learn.
Machine learning experience.
Scala, Java.
Proficient and experienced working with statistical models; Regression, Clustering, Classification, etc.

Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS SENIOR DATA ENGINEER / MACHINE LEARNING ENGINE...
Description:
Our client in the Financial space is looking for a Senior Data Engineer / Machine Learning Engineer with 6-8 years of experience .
Experience in creating Data ingestion and ELT/ETL pipeline, as well as using big data tools, i.e., Spark, Hadoop etc. Advanced programming (Java and Python) and systems creation skills with proven experience in a professional organisation setting
Specialisation in modern distributed systems and have an in-depth understanding of various big data technologies and data frameworks to use the right tools for the job.
Adept at combining the various technologies to create big data pipelines and software solutions to enable creation of advanced data products to support business processes.
Possess basic to intermediate knowledge of DevOps or DataOps, in order to work well with the organisation’s dedicated production systems administrators or DevOps team.
Able to take the advanced algorithms that the data scientist created or hacked together to work, and make them more production worthy as integral part of software products.
Building business-ready solutions around & operationalising and/or optimising the data scientists’ codes so they run well in production & adhere to good engineering principles.
Able to care for and continue to feed models running in production so that they do not go stale and/or start giving out incorrect or distorted results, by looking out for any changing nature of data, new data, or even malicious attacks that requires retraining or tweaking.

Title: Lead, Data & Insights - Digital Venture
Description:
Job: Technology
Primary Location: ASEAN & South Asia-Singapore-Singapore
Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Permanent
Posting Date: 14/May/2020
Unposting Date: Ongoing


We're looking for a Lead, Data & Insights, to work onsite within our Digital Venture office. We're a very small, but growing venture, with new and exciting problems to solve. We work in project-based sprints in small, interdisciplinary teams.
As a Lead, Data & Insights, you'd be able to work on and solve some of the many interesting challenges we are facing, learn new ways of working, and build delightful high quality products for our customers.
Lead, Data & Insights

Job Description
We are looking for a superstar candidate to help build and deliver a strategy and roadmap for making us a data-driven enterprise, driving enterprise-wide governance and utilization of information as an asset.
In this role, you will champion data usage, management, insights, governance and quality with a team of data analysts and data scientists.

Role Responsibilities
Drive overall data strategy
Establish data policies, standards and organization
Lead team of data analysts and data scientists to drive data insights and modelling
Lead all enterprise information/data management budgeting and initiatives
Establish a collection of integrated decision-support applications and databases, providing the business teams easy access to business data.
Work with the strategic partners to understand their data landscape and how we can best leverage our partnership
Lead on data sharing negotiations and implementation
Identify trends and insights, and optimise overall spend and performance
Drive adoption of data tools and dashboards and data driven decisions
Work with the compliance and finance teams to ensure regulatory compliance

Lead
Data Analytics: Combine and curate large amounts of transactional data and convert it to usable dashboards for different business units
Data Manager: Determine, establish and maintain data quality and maturity levels
Data Governor: Organize and implement policies, procedures, structures, roles, and responsibilities that outline and enforce rules of engagement, decision rights, and accountabilities
Data Scientist: Develop new insights, advanced modelling techniques and data science capabilities
Data Ethicist: Maintain oversight of how data is collected, safeguarded and shared and who controls it
Data Entrepreneur: Drive longer term vision of monetising data or deriving data-driven products and services

Support
Data Developer: Work with the Data Engineering team and Data Architects to design, create and implement enterprise grade data warehouses or data lakes
Data Defender: Lead cross functional teams to keep data safe from breaches, fraud, and attacks and engage regulators to ensure adherence to data safety rules

Our Ideal Candidate:
Bachelor’s and/or advanced degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Informatics, Information Systems, or other related fields.
Proven track record in data management, leadership and information technology systems and tools.
5+ years of leadership experience in business intelligence/ advanced analytics with experience using data visualization dashboards, BI tools and working in structured environments
Experience in rolling out leading analytics platforms at an enterprise level (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, Sisense, Thoughtspot, etc)
10+ years of leadership experience
Ability to translate and explain complex models and analytics to senior management and external stakeholders
Advanced knowledge and experience with best in class data management tools and data strategy design
Ability to convert business strategy into action- oriented objectives and measurable results
Ability to develop and manage a budget.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Experience in Agile way of working and tools (Jira, Confluence, Trello, Slack etc)
Comfort with a fast-paced environment and changing requirements

Good to have:
Experience working in financial services vertical a plus
Prior experience in brokering and implementing a data sharing arrangement a plus
Startup experience a plus

Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.

Title: Research Scientist / Project Manager
Description:
Research Scientist / Project Manager

What we offer
You will work on exciting and challenging topics together with a team in an ultra-modern, innovative and creative environment. Intensive on-the-job training with expert colleagues guarantees you will quickly become familiar with your duties and perform them independently.
Click here to learn more about Evonik from our employees

The Scientist position is critical to execute current and future projects in Smart Surface Solutions. He/she will manage the project (from idea into a product development and subsequently launch of the product the production) with the support of the lab team.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Initiate & execute R&D projects in the area of Functional Coatings for Industrial application.
Innovate, develop, formulate and design new or improved functional coating for industrial application.
Ensure all necessary lab research activities can be carried out within the timeline of the projects and with good quality outcome
Develop his/her own idea to enhance the success of the project/program, initiate follow-up discussion. Keep up-to-date on the latest technology & business development in the area.
Plans experiments and activities based on established projects as well as new, exploratory ideas. Conduct literature searches associated with assigned projects.
Formulates, applies and characterizes material for functional coating experiments. Documents results and prepares technical reports with summaries and analysis for internal and external customers.
Develops new or revise tests, processes or procedures to support program or project goals.
Interface with various external partners including customers and thus is an important representative of Evonik R&D activities to the external collaborators.
For Senior Scientist: additionally to lead a junior scientist and/or a team of chemist/technician that will support the job

REQUIREMENTS
Masters or PhD in Chemistry, Polymer Science, Material Science or related subjects with minimum 3 years working experience in coatings-related area; specifically with projects/work experience related to coating formulation, application and testings; or
BSc candidates with >5 years relevant experience can also be considered.
Creative
Ability to set goals to work independently in conducting experiments, organizing data and analysis of the results.
Proven project management and project execution skills, with the ability to drive customer adoption of new technologies and existing products (Senior Scientist)
Strong laboratory technical skills, in particular coating formulation, application, testing and characterisation
Self-driving & self-motivating, initiate & drive projects/ideas independently. Highly motivated and enthusiastic entrepreneur spirit.
Comfortable to deal with high uncertainty & ambiguity. Not afraid to take a risk & willing to learn from failure
Collaborative team player, being able to be a team leader as well as team player. Take a leadership/coordination role on projects, especially those initiated by him/herself.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Excellent language skill in English is essential and knowledge of basic German is advantageous.

Your Application
To ensure the fastest process of your application and to protect the environment, please apply online via our careers portal at https://careers.evonik.com.

Evonik Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other legally protected status.
Please note that Evonik will not accept any unsolicited application documents sent by staffing firms. Evonik works in conjunction with preferred service providers and will not pay any fee to staffing firms in the absence of an appropriate framework agreement. Should Evonik receive a candidate profile from a staffing firm with which it has no framework agreement, and should this candidate subsequently be considered in the recruitment process or offered employment, no claims from the staffing firm will be entertained in this regard.

Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
The AI team at Graphene is focused on cutting-edge R&D and Engineering to come up with products and services related to market research.

Reporting to the VP (Engineering), the Sr. Data Scientist will function as the AI/Data Science expert on the team. This team member will understand the roadmap/requirements, translate it into technical architecture, and guide the team to implement the architecture and navigate the roadmap.

This team member will be responsible for quantifying and qualifying data to be used, ensuring that data is cleaned and persisted to be secure, consistent, and organized to support delivery.

He/she will be responsible for providing the expertise and guidance for creating appropriate ML models, getting them validated/benchmarked and integrated with the ML pipeline. This would include the creation of appropriate validation datasets.

He/she will be responsible for ensuring modular architecture i.e. models can be plugged in and out based on requirements e.g. changing domains or languages.

He/she will have to coach and guide other team members towards achieving goals and maximizing productivity.

He/she can also expect to be involved in these activities: participating in client meetings, understanding project requests and requirements, project documentation, liaising between delivery and commercial teams and ensuring the output meets the project commitments on quality, completeness and timeliness.

Responsibilities and Duties
Lead a bright team of data scientist to design, develop and evaluate machine learning models suitable for text analytics including NER, Coref Resolution, Clustering, Sentiment Analysis, Econometric models, Statistical Models.

Explore cutting-edge techniques leveraging AI/ML in identifying the right algorithms, tools, techniques, libraries, to achieve high accuracy and performance.

Work closely with product development teams to develop new algorithms, improve existing algorithms and models, scale models to cover multiple languages and domains.

High-level critical thinking and creative problem-solving abilities.

Effectively communicate with fellow technologists and other stakeholders.
Qualifications and Skills
A graduate/master's degree in computer science, applied statistics or a quantitative domain.

Non-trivial project experience in natural language processing - extracting insightful information from free text.

Strong working knowledge of Statistics, Statistical Models, Big Data, Supervised and Unsupervised Machine Learning, and Deep Learning.

Knowledge of packages such as Tensorflow, Pytorch, Keras, Scikit Learn, Pandas, NLTK, Gensim, spaCy.

Knowledge of models based on BERT, multilingual models, etc.

Have experience with constituency and dependency parsers, anaphora and word sense disambiguation, language models, knowledge graph etc.

Strong cross-platform skills (Linux and Windows).

Hands-on coding skills

Title: Energy & Data Scientist
Description:
DATA SCIENTIST - ENERGY & DIGITAL TECHNOLOGIES
Based in Singapore
Formative Search is working with an international energy technology company with its headquarter in France. Our client offers an intelligence platform coupled with human expertise to identify energy efficiency potentials in the industry. These potentials can give lead to medium / long-term projects or be used for automatic optimisations whether being linked to energy markets or through control-command.
Their mission insists in reshaping the way energy data is used to optimize the energy performance of manufacturers and to improve industrial processes and turn energy into a profit centre and their data science algorithms.
Since 2016, the company has grown significantly, acquiring many new customers and expanding in different countries in Europe and on the American and Asian continents. They are urgently looking for a Data Scientist, who will get involved in innovative projects, the mission is aimed to be the internal Data Science referent for the entire APAC area and to support project managers on analysis, modelling, and optimization for their many customers.
In partnership with an Operations Manager - Singapore and the Head of Data Science - France, this role will be required to participate in extremely varied projects where you will be able to be autonomous.
Roles & Responsibilities :
Participated in the creation and production of predictive models for customer needs
Carried out complex analyzes to highlight and exploit levers of energy optimization
Support project managers in their analyzes
Communicate your results internally and to our customers in a clear and educational manner
Prototyping, generating and putting into production algorithms
Intervene on an ad hoc basis on projects of the Innovation and Sales team


What experience & skills should you have for this role?
Bachelors Degree in IT, computer science, math, physics or other related field
Minimum 3 years of working experience
Proficiency in Python.
Proficiency in data manipulation and machine learning tools (such as Pandas, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow).
Knowledge and use of classic Machine Learning algorithms (Linear Regression, Random Forest, SVM, etc.).
Use of versioning tools (Git)
Having knowledge of the energy sector is a definite plus.
Oral and written fluency English in order to communicate complex results in a clear and concise manner both internally and with our customers.

Working cross-functionally with business managers/product managers/engineers and data scientists to gather requirements and to understand their business processes

A history of working with large scale reliable data systems

Experience with big data tools and delivery of big data solutions
Experience in working with different types of data stores including SQL, NoSQL, warehouses, lakes, etc

Description:
The Offer Help define how people find jobs and get hired as roles change in the coming decade Build and lead a best in class data team Leadership Role The Employer Snaphunt is a smart hiring platform that helps people find jobs and companies hire talent quickly and conveniently. Our client is an Artificial Intelligence Platform and they are looking for a highly analytical Data Science Researcher (Python / Spark / Hadoop) to explore huge datasets from various environments and apply state of the art AI/ML techniques to solve real world business problems.

You will have a strong background in Natural Language Processing (NLP), coupled with relevant working experience in Graph databases and Graph algorithms.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Upskills is looking for a Data Engineer to build something great with us. As part of the Machine Learning team, you will work with both Data Scientist and Client to develop and own stable, scalable, and repeatable data-driven features. We're looking for a self-motivated engineer who has a passion for working with an event-based architecture heavily leveraging the AWS/GGC/Azure cloud data stack & tools. The data engineering team is core to driving and delivering the current and future data, analytics, and decisioning platforms across Upskills.


Here is what you'll be doing:

· Work with data scientist and product management to implement data-driven features/product

· Apply architecture and system design theories and principles, perform complex work in research, design and development of new or existing products, tools and processes required for the operation, maintenance and testing of products.

· Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.

· Be a key contributor in the engineering of distributed systems, frameworks, and design patterns of Data Science/Machine Learning

· Use Scala, Java or Python to utilize Hadoop/Spark to collect and analyse large-scale datasets in batch and real-time

· Build, monitor, and maintain data ETL pipelines

· Mentor internship/junior data engineers in principles and best practices

Share relevant knowledge and evangelize Data Engineering with Machine Learning teams


Requirements
Here is what we're looking for:


· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field or equivalent work experience

· More than 2 years of advanced Python or Java development is necessary. Scala, Rust or Go experience is a plus.

· Experience working in the Hadoop ecosystem, using tools such as Hive, Spark, or Pig. Experience with Apache Kafka is a plus.

· Experience working in the containerization system, using platform such as Docker or Openshift

· Proven expertise in taking Machine Learning projects from conception to implementation

· Experience with event-driven architecture design patterns and practices

· Experience in database design and architecture principles, and strong SQL abilities

· Experience with the following a strong plus:

o AWS DynamoDB, Hive, Cassandra, Bigtable, or other big data stores

o Experience in custom ELT pipeline design, implementation and maintenance (Airflow or other similar tools)

· Agile development experience

Title: Junior Data Consultant
Description:
Who we are
Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we're enjoying skyrocketing growth.
Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients' specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we've acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.
We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.
What you will be doing
With the support of a senior consultant, you will have the opportunity to carry out various projects independently and in collaboration with Artefact's teams of experts: Strategy, Activation, Analytics, Data, Creation.
At the agency or at the client's premises, the consultant is a true project manager. The diversity of your missions will allow you to be as close as possible to customer issues, to acquire a real knowledge of data and to quickly develop your skills.
Your missions will include:
define the needs of its customers by conducting interviews with customer teams and multiple technology partners,
to help build, formulate and present strategic data recommendations for the client,
to organize and conduct workshops and training to ensure the success of its projects,
to develop and present data recommendations to clients,
to imagine and present new support proposals to convince our future customers,
to participate in training courses to acquire the technical knowledge necessary for its mission as an advisor and to keep abreast of the latest technological innovations on the market,
and finally to participate in the writing of content on transversal subjects (e.g. publication of research works, writing articles or business cases).

What we are looking for
Graduated from a business school (desired), the most important qualities in our eyes are intellectual curiosity, autonomy and dynamism.
A first knowledge of digital marketing (within a start-up, agency, etc.) or consulting (Strategy, Management, IS), will obviously be valued.

Why you should join us
Artefact is the place to be: come and build the future of marketing
Progress: every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
Culture: join the best team you could ever imagine
Entrepreneurship: you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won't give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!

Come join us!

Title: Data Product Team
Description:
Job Description
We are looking for a talented Data Engineer to join our growing team. You will be responsible for expanding our data collection as well as optimizing data pipelines for cross-functional teams. Ideally, you are an experienced engineer who enjoys optimizing data pipeline and building them from scratch. You will support business analysts, software engineers, and data scientists and ensure optimal on-time delivery of ongoing projects. You will be a self-starter and thrive in supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems, and products. Experience in e-commerce industry will be a plus.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Build both batch and streaming data pipeline for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using big data technologies

Deliver data projects to support customer acquisition, operational efficiency, campaign and other key business performance metrics

Monitor & manage data pipelines, ensuring accuracy and stability

Diagnose, analyse and provide solutions to issues in scripts, reports, tools, data, etc.

Work with stakeholders and sort out data-related issues

Identify, design and implement improvements, e.g. automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing architecture for greater scalability, etc.

Provide on-call support on a roster basis
Job Requirements
Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or similar

5+ years of relevant working experience

Familiar with Hadoop big data platform architecture: HDFS/HBase/Hive/MapReduce, proficient in Hive SQL, understand real-time computing, and have previous experience in using open source real-time streaming engines such as Flink and Spark Streaming

Familiar with dimensional data modelling, and data warehouse concepts and methodologies as well as distributed processing systems

Experience with programming and understanding of basic algorithms

Previous experience in building reports via reporting tools is a plus

E-commerce experience is a plus

Attention to details and strong problem-solving skills

Respect diversity and different cultures

Excellent communication skills

Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS MANAGER, ALGORITHM ENGINEER
Company: LAZADA SOUTH EAST ASIA PTE. LTD.
Description:
You will work in a vertically integrated team of engineers, analysts, data scientists and product managers. You are expected to formulate clear problem definitions, work on proof of concepts to demonstrate the feasibility of new projects and also help carry this into production. Sound fundamentals on basic data science concepts as regression, classification and clustering problems is to be expected. Knowledge and experience in applying operations research techniques is highly preferred. We’re looking for a candidate who is proactive, challenges the status quo and has a strong drive to improve some of the region’s most difficult logistical problems.
Job Requirements
Job requirements

Willingness to adapt and learn
Solid programming skills in at least one language (preferably Python)
Good working knowledge of SQL
Experience in data analysis and machine learning libraries (pandas, numpy, seaborn, ggplot, sk-learn, TensorFlow etc.)
Given that we do optimization problems in Java, candidates must have an inclination towards taking up Java in day to day activities
Preferred skills
Knowledge of networking problems
Knowledge of JVM languages (Scala, Kotlin, Java)
Experience in applying operations research techniques in academic or business context
Knowledge of operations research libraries (CPLEX, Gurobi, Optaplanner, etc.)
As you will be working in the logistics domain any domain expertise in transport, warehousing or aviation is highly valued
Hands on experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Spotfire, Qlik, etc.
Exposure to cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, etc.

Title: Data Analytics Engineer
Description:
The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) aspires to be world-class in delivering a safe and secure home for our people. In pursuing our mission to help make Singapore safe and secure, we remain always constant and true to our core values of Honour and Unity.
We utilise state-of-the-art technology and technical know-how to safeguard Singapore’s security and sovereignty. We need highly motivated Data Analytics Engineers to design and build powerful data science and analytics tools required to conduct data mining and facilitate data-driven decision making.
Besides being passionate about data, analytics and software engineering, candidates should also be driven by our mission to make Singapore a safer home, and enjoy working on challenging, diverse and unique problem statements. You will be supported by a team of highly technical and collaborative colleagues with opportunities for advanced training, including leading overseas conferences and courses.

Responsibilities
Design, develop, deploy and maintain analytics solutions that allow internal business teams to make data-driven decisions
Evaluate, adopt, integrate and build on open-source and commercial analytics tools
Work closely with end users, data scientists, data engineers and project managers in the planning, development and delivery of solutions
Evaluate, maintain and optimise code for accuracy, performance, maintainability and scale of data queries, machine learning models and data visualizations
Recommend and evaluate technologies to introduce new analytics capabilities

Requirements
Singapore Citizens only.
Fresh Graduates are welcome to apply.
Self-motivated, open-minded, resourceful and meticulous. Able to work independently and in teams.
Ability to keep the overarching objectives of the project in mind while pursuing the technical details.
Competent in at least one programming language (e.g. Python, Java, JavaScript, C/C++, C#, base SAS, R, Scala). Interest and ability to gain expertise in other programming languages, frameworks and technologies.
Familiarity with one or more database and its related querying languages (e.g. SQL, Pig, Hive, SparkQL).
Knowledge and experience with any of the following would be an advantage:
o Machine learning (e.g. predictive analytics, natural language processing)
o Data analytics (e.g. descriptive statistics, modelling)
o Big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Impala, HBase, Elasticsearch)
o Web development (e.g. HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python, Ruby on Rails)
o Data visualisation (e.g. UX/UI design, PowerBI, D3, Tableau)
o System administration (e.g. OS, networking, databases)
o Containers technologies (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
Autodesk is seeking a highly motivated Senior Software Engineer to join our agile development team! As a member of a team responsible for building foundational services, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the development of identity service that is leveraged by 150+ Autodesk desktop, mobile and web applications as well as a growing third party developer ecosystem for managing authentication, authorization, profile and entitlements. The service is one of the key business enablers serving millions of customers every day. You will be working on cutting edge AWS technologies, leveraging authentication and authorization related protocols.

Responsibilities
Work effectively as a member of self-organized agile team that builds, owns and runs the service
Contribute to all aspects of service development including front-end, back-end, devops and quality
Assist in the operation of the service, e.g. monitoring, alerting, metrics, logging and troubleshooting
Work closely with architect and product management to understand requirements and translate them to elegant implementations
Use the current system behavior to identify opportunities for continuous improvement of the scalability, reliability, usability and security of the system
Excellent troubleshooting skills, able to debug complex technical issues involving multiple system components


Minimum Qualifications
BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field
More than 8 years of experience building web applications
Experience with ASP.NET MVC/Web API/RESTful API design
Expert level experience with programming languages such as C#/Java
Expert level experience in building services with high performance, high availability at web scale
Solid understanding of software design and architectural patterns
Committed to quality, including security and performance
Experience with agile methodologies
Possess strong verbal and written communication skills


Preferred Qualifications
Strong design and coding skills with the ability to pick up new languages, tools and design patterns as needed
Experience with AWS stack and containers is a plus
UI Development experience with HTML 5, CSS 3, JavaScript
Strong experience with relational and non-relational data stores
Experience leveraging or contributing to open source projects


About Autodesk
With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It's disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital scientists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider employment for all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.
To all recruitment agencies: Autodesk does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Autodesk will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Autodesk, Inc.

Title: Data Product Manager
Description:
Date posted: May 13, 2020
Location: Singapore, SG
Job Function: Sales & Marketing
Job Type: Permanent
Job Requisition ID: 3498
Data Product Manager
About the Unit
There are more than 500 million smallholder farms globally. 2.5 billion people depend on Smallholder Communities for their food and livelihoods. Smallholder regions are characterized by low living standards, high rates of illiteracy and low agricultural productivity. Yara's mission is "Responsibly Feed the World and Protect the Planet". Key to achieving this is enabling thriving Smallholder Communities.

In 2017, Yara created the business unit, Digital Farming. At Yara Digital Farming, we are building solutions for farming communities, constructing hardware and sensors, crunching satellite data, applying artificial intelligence, and turning research results into services, products and solutions, all aimed at achieving this mission.

Our team is made up of designers, software engineers, hardware developers, data scientists, services and solution managers and product owners. Digital Farming is a strategic priority within Yara. Each year we significantly grow our global Digital Farming team and country coverage. With hubs in Europe, Latin America, Asia and North America, Yara Digital Farming is shaping the future of farming by building new digital solutions solving critical problems within agriculture.

Responsibilities
Primarily responsible for creating, maintaining and showcasing a portfolio of data products, features and their specifications
Maintain a roadmap for data products, activities aligned to short term and strategic business goals
Work with stakeholders to explore and present opportunities to create customer and business value through data
Act as a bridge representing various aspects of data team (data engg, analytics, data science) to the Solution/Business, Engineering, Design and Agronomy organizations
Gather business requirements, prioritize product backlog and plan for required future capacity
Understand the technical implementation and standardize features & (API) interfaces across data products
Drive innovation through building rapid POCs and conducting experiments with the help of available in-house capacity, interns, freelancers or vendors
Play an active role in Agile project management using Atlassian tools (Jira and Confluence) and continuously develop process improvements and automation
This role could involve spending up to 30% of time in terms of technical contribution to the data products being developed
Profile
Experience in the areas of Data Architecture / Warehousing, Data Product Development, API Management and Data Science lifecycles
Have a strong track record of delivering at least two data products in a commercial environment
Technological acuteness as demonstrated by understanding a wide variety of data tools such as BI, Python, SQL, CICD tools, containerization, database scripts etc.
Self-motivated candidate who can work just as easily as an individual and as a team member
Bachelor's degree or higher
Additional Information
We encourage all qualified applicants from all backgrounds to apply and are committed to creating a work environment that fits gender equality and allows combining career progress with the needs of a family or other personal circumstances.
Why us?
Evolving tech development division of an established agricultural products and services company.
Explore and develop digital, software, hardware products, which provide value to farmers, smallholder communities and the value chain.
Be part of our mission to build sustainable solutions that benefit humanity and the environment.
Full-time, permanent and freelance contract options available with competitive remuneration + benefits.
Support for personal development, training and continuous learning.
Commitment to using new technologies and frameworks, meetups, and knowledge sharing.
Apply no later than

Job Segment: Agricultural, Agronomy, Database, Engineer, Data Management, Agriculture, Technology, Engineering, Data

Title: Digital Use-case Innovator for Industries & Energy
Description:
What are my responsibilities?
Identifying and describing data-driven use-cases in related relevant verticals
Creation of / Drive design thinking for Innovative digital services and applications for the Urban MAC Singapore
Consulting / Co-creating with potential customers, incl. defining & validating problem statements, creating user stories, analyzing & evaluating user needs and requirements, and analyzing customer value-drivers
Comprehensively specifying value-propositions and validating requirements for digital use-cases, mapping them to relevant Siemens technologies and IOT offerings with revenue potential, ensuring technical feasibility & commercial viability
Evaluating business case, developing and evaluating appropriate business & contractual models, calculating the benefit value and pricing-base of SW applications / digital solutions
Managing "end-to-end" innovation of compelling digital use-cases for industrial & urban infrastructure (software applications and/or digitally enabled services) as well as individual phases from the identification of value creation potential to requirements analysis with the customer, through rapid prototyping development by agile teams of data scientists and software developers, to operative implementation of a minimum marketable product
Preparing proposals to external & internal customers for service offerings and to respond to RFIs and RFPs
What do I need to qualify for this job?
Master’s degree or Bachelor in Engineering, Computer Science or Management
4+ years of professional experience in B2B or B2G environment of the industrial or infrastructure sector covering functions such as management consulting, corporate venturing, business development, solution sales, product or innovation management
Relevant experience in project management. Appropriate certification (e.g. PMI, SCRUM) is desirable
Strong business analysis skills and experience, such as development of business strategies, functional decomposition of value drivers, requirements capture, and process modeling is a must
Awareness of cloud computing and edge computing technologies, big data analytics, as well as IT / Data/ Software architecture frameworks is a plus
Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
Ability to think analytically and rapidly learn complex topics, especially in the field of fuzzily or none-defined problems
Ability to present complex technical and operational information comprehensible to an expert and non-expert audience as well as on senior management level
Comfortable working at top-management level, sound experience in C-level sales
Working experience abroardis preferable
Excellent English verbal and written skills
Self-motivated and proactive, with strong entrepreneurial spirit can demonstrate initiative, assertiveness and a result-oriented approach

Company: Siemens Pte Ltd
Experience Level: Experienced Professional
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Data Science Researcher (Python / Spark / Hadoop)
Description:
Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
Highly Collaborative Environment
About Our Client
Our client is an Artificial Intelligence Platform and they are looking for a highly analytical Data Science Researcher (Python / Spark / Hadoop) to explore huge datasets from various environments and apply state of the art AI/ML techniques to solve real world business problems.
Job Description
As the Data Science Researcher (Python / Spark / Hadoop), you are responsible for:
Engaging with clients and identifying key problem statements in the areas of risk, fraud or natural language processing (NLP).
Researching and experimenting with state-of-the-art machine learning (ML) / AI algorithms to solve said key problem statements.
Driving continuous functionality and feature improvements of the AI products.
Collaborating with other research scientists and engineers to formulate innovative solutions to implement advanced AI techniques and taking them to production.
The Successful Applicant
As a successful applicant, you will have a PhD in Computer Science or equivalent with minimum of 2 years of experience in the Data Science domain, backed by a good track record of working on Anomaly Detection and Clustering use cases. You will also be an expert with Python as a programming language, backed by a strong understanding of Big Data infrastructure technologies such as Spark / Hadoop etc.
You will have a strong background in Natural Language Processing (NLP), coupled with relevant working experience in Graph databases and Graph algorithms.
