Title: Scientist II
Description:
Req ID: 34601
Job Description
Are you inspired to contribute to a global leading Flavors & Fragrances organization? Are you passionate in exploring Fragrance formulation and developing the Fragrances of tomorrow?
IFF is seeking a highly motivated and results driven individual to join our Scent Technology & Innovation (ST&I) Singapore division as Scientist II.

What you will contribute and lead
As Scientist II you will be involved in managing and running technical projects for the Body Care category. Your role includes internal creative support for fragrance/technology performance & stability as well as external technical expertise demonstration in front of customer.

The role would require you to thoroughly implement IFF technology and investigate Fragrance solutions that satisfy consumers’ needs in the Body Care category. Our ambition is to exceed our customer’s technical expectations when introducing new products and formulations to ensure that IFF is seen as the most technically innovative Fragrance house.

In addition, you must have the ability to lead sizeable technical projects that are either proactive or go to market (G2M). You will need to develop and build a continuous healthy and strong intimacy with all our customers.

Your Focus
Generate, report and present profound knowledge on technical issues related to formulation, interactions of Fragrances with the bases and technologies to improve the performance and stability of Fragrances.
Analysis of Fragrance’s ingredients and their interactions in different bases and applications.
Perform review, analysis and interpretation of data analytics.
Prepare applications samples for trouble shooting exercises.
Provide technical support on technologies to internal and external customers.
Management of projects and specific tasks to ensure timely delivery or request.
Create strong business relationships with clients based on trust and expertise.
Close collaboration with the application laboratory, stability coordinator and cross functional teams.
Job Requirements
Essential Skills
Master’s or Bachelor Degree in Science & Technology, Chemistry or any other relevant discipline
Knowledgeable in Body care applications, raw materials and chemical processes
Results driven & agile in a fast-moving environment
Excellent communication skills to both internal and external customers
Effective communication with excellent presentation skills
Strong data analysis capability for interpretation of results
Fragrance formulation and development technical skills
Good knowledge of safety for technical laboratories
Olfactory ability

Essential Experience
Minimum 5 years’ experience in the Consumer Goods or Ingredients Chemical industry
Personal wash/hair care technical formulation and development or fragrance industry experience Technical projects management experience
Good in building strong customer relations and capable in leading sizeable technical projects that are either proactive or go to market (G2M)
Strong technical creativity ability to provide new technical insights & recommendations for capabilities improvement that support project decision-making, category strategy and customers propositions to highlight IFF product advantages.
Comfortable working in a B2B environment with a positive, self-driven or results oriented attitude.
Strong teamwork, customer orientation, project management, effective time management skills with proven ability to oversee all assigned projects and meeting deadlines

At IFF, we believe that your uniqueness unleashes our potential. We value the diverse mosaic of the ethnicity, national origin, race, age, sex or veteran status. We strive for inclusive workplace that allows each of our colleagues to bring their authentic self to work regardless of their religion, gender identity & expression, sexual orientation, or disability. Visit IFF.com/careers/workplace-diversity-and-inclusion to learn more…

Visit us at www.iff.com to learn more about how we’re using Uncommon Sense to challenge expected, champion creators, and do more good for people and planet.

Title: Big Data Engineer
Description:
Job Purpose:
We are looking for a Big Data Engineer to join our team creating new pipelines to process and learn from financial data. You will work closely with product owners, data scientist and team members to deliver solutions through new and existing channels.
Job Background/context:
We believe the future is with us !
Home to where we define, ideate, develop and distribute production-ready financial solutions of far-reaching impact. And right now, the door’s open to direct the future of our technology for a truly global client base. This means collaborating with the keenest minds in data science, big data, software engineering, web development, UX design and more. Doers looking to bring the next bold ideas to life for a fascinating array of clients - investing, trading and transacting at the forefront of change in markets and economies the world over.
If you have this kind of vision, capable of seeing ahead, of developing a clear path forward in a quest to try the as yet untried, here is the opportunity. In a supported, resource-rich, vibrant co-working environment, part of an ecosystem of globally interconnected labs, realising a broader mission of enabling growth and economic progress on a scale you won’t find anywhere else. Welcome to our APAC Cross Markets Analytics & Digitization (CMAD), Team
Key Responsibilities:
Architect and process complex datasets with Spark, Beam, etc
Read/write data with Kafka, HDFS, S3, Postgres etc
Produce fault-tolerant, intelligent data processing pipelines
Skills & Qualifications:
You have a great understanding of the Python language and standard library
You understand how to use a data processing framework, such as Apache Spark or Beam
You know how to read/write data to message and storage platforms, such as Apache Kafka, HDFS or Amazon S3

Title: Research Engineer / Research Assistant
Description:
Wilmar International, a major food production company, and the ECE Department of National University of Singapore (NUS) are jointly building new research programs that investigate biosensor chips for food technology. The aim is to develop wireless biosensing system to monitor in-package food quality and composition.

We are inviting talented Ph.D. candidates to investigate biosensor and biosensing system research in this new and exciting new field at the cross road of materials, electronics, data science, and food technology. A four-year scholarship at the NUS ECE leading to an Engineering Doctorate or Ph.D. are being offered.

Successful applicants will become full-time employee of Wilmar International, with full employee salary and benefits, during the doctorate program. He/she is expected to work in NUS as well as Wilmar laboratories. The work involves multidisciplinary collaboration with biochemists, food scientists, and data/AI scientists to integrate the system.

Qualifications
Must possess a B.Eng/B.Sc./M.Eng/M.S.c.in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Chem/Bio-medical Engineering or related fields from a reputable University/Institute.
Demonstrate strong scholastic accomplishments and passionate about a career in R&D. Candidates are subjected to candidate selection processes by NUS ECE department as well as Wilmar International, successful candidates will be offered a scholarship and an employment contract with Wilmar International and he/she will be expected to work at NUS as well as Wilmar International laboratories. The terms of employment contract is defined by Wilmar International.

Interested applicants should send their motivation letter, curriculum vitae, and publication list via email to Prof. Aaron Thean (Aaron.Thean@nus.edu.sg) or Dr. Untzizu Elejalde (untzizu.elejalde@sg.wilmar-intl.com).

Title: Research Associate, Ocular Imaging
Description:
The Singapore Eye Research Institute (SERI) serves as Singapore’s national research institute for ophthalmic and vision research. SERI functions as the research arm of the various clinical ophthalmic centres in Singapore, including the Singapore National Eye Centre (SNEC), the national clinical centre for ophthalmology in Singapore. SERI has developed a world-leading reputation in broad-based clinical translational research programmes for eye diseases.
SERI is seeking a highly qualified individual to take on a significant role in a rapidly expanding ocular imaging program. The position offers the opportunity to do excellent research work at SERI.
He/ She will assist the Investigators and Consultants in the successful execution of the project(s). He/ She will be expected to:
Perform statistical analysis for ocular imaging data
Compile data, summarize and interpret results of the analysis in reports and journal articles
Collaborate with other imaging- and data scientists to derive and validate novel image-based algorithms in support of eye disease detection and patient risk stratification
The duties and responsibilities outlined are not intended to be an exhaustive list but provide guidance on the main aspects of the job. The incumbent will be required to be flexible in their duties.
Auto req ID
6806BR
Job Requirements
Bachelor of Science with 1 year of experience or M.Sc.in the field of Statistics, Applied Statistics, Mathematics, or Biostatistics or a related discipline.
Strong understanding of statistics as applied to data analysis and modelling.
Experience using major statistical analysis packages, such as R or Stata for data manipulation, visualization and modelling.
Previous exposure to programming languages and image processing skills such as MATLAB, Python.
Previous experience in optical coherence tomography (OCT) image analysis and software development in OCT and OCT signal analysis would be an advantage.
Able to work independently, as well as in a team-based, cross-functional research team
Job Category
Research
Job Function
Research / Survey Services
Employment Type
Contract Full Time
Location
Singapore
Education Level
Master's Degree

Title: Big Data Engineer (Data Security Implementation and Design)
Description:
As a Big Data Engineer within the Data Platform and Management team in Group IT, you will be establishing, developing, expanding and optimizing the data control architecture, design and implementation.

Your role includes:

Design, develop and implement data security, privacy, protection and associated control technology solutions as per best industry practice
Evaluate and renew implemented data security, privacy, overall data control solutions to ensure their relevancy and effectiveness in supporting business needs and regulatory requirement (PDPA, GDPR, Telecom act and etc.)
Drive development, optimization, testing and tooling to improve overall data control management (Security, Consent Management, Privacy, protection)
Review, analyze, benchmark and approve solution design from product companies, internal teams and vendors.
Ensure that proposed solutions are aligned and conformed to the data landscape, big data architecture guidelines and roadmap.

Responsibilities

Design and implement data security, privacy, protection framework and optimize service and access management
Understand business requirement and solution design to develop and implement solutions that adhere to big data architectural guidelines, address regulatory and compliance requirements
Design, develop and maintain data security and privacy framework, policy, solution and systems
Design, develop and maintain data protection and consent management systems
Drive BAU process, testing and tooling to improve data security, privacy and protection
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, control and optimizing data technology service delivery
Build robust and scalable data infrastructure to support needs from internal and external users, regulators and compliance requirement
Review and approve high level & detailed design to ensure that the solution delivers to the business needs and align to the data landscape and analytics, architecture principles and roadmap.
Understand and solution latest data security standards and tools to apply and adhere to the required data controls for user access in Cloudera/Hadoop, Oracle and other DB platform and overall data environment and projects
Support and contribute to development guidelines and standards for data security, privacy with Risk, Compliance, Regulatory functions
Work with infrastructure, operations, data scientist and business analytics team to assist in data related technical issues and implement effective solutions.

The ideal candidate should possess

Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data/Business Analytics or equivalent with 10-12 years of experience in data warehousing / Big Data/Hadoop / RDBMS – Security, Privacy, Protection technologies and tools
Expert in building data management solutions - data security, privacy solutions, architectures and Implementation
Ability to troubleshoot and issue resolution complex security, privacy requirement
Experience on structured and unstructured data design / modelling, data access, security and data storage techniques
Experience with relational SQL and NOSQL DB
Experience to do cost estimation based on the design and development
Experience with Agile, DevOps tools and environment
Hadoop / Big Data platform and it’s components knowledge and experience
Informatica data management tools (EDC, AXON, Secure@source, IDQ, BDQ), IBM Guardium Data Protection or equivalent
Data encryption, security management techniques and methodology
Dynamic Data Masking – Informatica Suite, Protegrity, Oracle/Teradata Dynamic Masking or equivalent.
Key Management Tech stack – AWS KMS, Thales and etc.
Micro-services – API, good to have API management tool Experience – Mulesoft, Apigee and etc.
Highly organized, self-motivated, pro-active, and able to plan
Ability to analyze and understand complex problems and translating into business terms
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong in User Requirements Gathering, Maintenance and Support
Managing operation, user expectation and vendors

Cor e e xpe r t i s e includes Distribution Network Modeling & Analysis

Solid knowledge of the electric utility industry, preferably in the area of distribution system analysis, management and automation; particular areas of interest would include load modeling, state estimation, parameter & topology detection/estimation, and model calibration

Deep knowledge of smart meter data analytics and statistical analysis

Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST/TEAM LEAD

Help define how people find jobs and get hired as roles change in the coming decade

Leadership Role

Snaphunt is a smart hiring platform that helps people find jobs and companies hire talent quickly and conveniently.
We are headquartered in Singapore and are backed by top venture capitalists. Our solutions cater to employers across South and South-East Asia and we are now looking to expand our team as a result of our business growth.

You are a strong mentor and coach who can build high performing teams

Title: ED / SVP, Platform Architect, Group Consumer Banking and Big...
Description:
Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.

Responsibilities
Define and own end to end architecture for Big Data Analytics Solutions for Consumer Banking Group. Drive our data analytics and ML application architecture.
Engage with business analysts, marketing, operations teams in Consumer Banking Group to understand their needs and create big data analytics solutions that meet the business needs
Work closely with Big Data Engineering and Data Science team to implement, troubleshoot, and optimise distributed applications based on modern big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc. in both an on premise and cloud deployment model to solve large scale processing problems.
Lead the transformation of a peta-byte scale batch-based processing platform to a near real-time
Streaming platform using technologies such as Kafka and Spark.
Transition several 100’s of existing applications (based in Teradata, Informatica, Qlik View, SAS based analytics and ML models) to modern big data analytics applications based on Hadoop, Spark, Kafka etc
Well versed with Data Sciences, Machine learning and Deep Learning based solutions and frameworks. Apply technical knowledge to architect solutions that meet business and IT needs infusing key analytics and ML technologies where appropriate
Provide expert level support to data scientists, data engineers, and operations to deliver high quality analytics, machine learning data pipelines, APIs and end to end solutions.
Maintain and advance deep technical skills and knowledge, keeping up to date with market trends and competitive insights, and share within the technical community
Develop deep relationships with key business stakeholders and decision makers to drive cloud adoption within their company to enable them to be cloud advocates
Requirements
Technical Degree, min of Bachelors in Computer Science or adjacent fields with 15+ years of software development experience
10+ years of expertise in Big Data technologies including Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Hadoop, No-SQL databases such as Hbase, Cassandra, OLAP columnar storage systems, Bit Map indexes to handle millions of consumers and thousands of attributes while allowing real-time querying and segmentation
Must have hands on coding skills in Java or Python
Experience in building data services and applications on both structured and unstructured streaming data
Experience in operationalising Machine Learning workflows to scale
Breadth of technical experience and expertise in Business Intelligence, Big Data and Data Science
Proven track record of driving architecture decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through with exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences (Senior Executives, IT management and engineers)
Hunger to Learn & Teach – Genuine interest to learn new technologies and share it with rest of the engineering team to keep them up-to-date on technology trends.
Problem solver – Enjoy new and meaningful technology or business challenges which require you to think and respond quickly
Open source – Prefer open source technologies and build it yourself mentality, open source contribution is highly preferred.
Team player – Enjoy working collaboratively with a talented group of people to tackle challenging business problems so we all succeed (or fail fast) as a team
Ability to travel up to 25% of the time
Preferred Skills
Experience with big data analytics and data science solutions developed in large cloud computing infrastructures such as Amazon Web Services, Azure Cloud, and/or Google Cloud
Prior experience as a data architect in designing large, complex enterprise data environments, for both structured and unstructured data. Expertise in data modelling, data governance, data mastering, meta-data management, data security and compliance, data lifecycle management, data-tiering and data archiving
Presence in open source projects will be huge plus.
Experience with Personalisation, Recommendation, Audience Segmentation systems

Title: Staff Optical R&D Engineer
Description:
Job Opening ID: 121950
Singapore, Singapore
Full-Time
Regular

Company Overview
Calling the adventurers ready to join a company that's pushing the limits of nanotechnology to keep the digital revolution rolling. At KLA, we're making technology advancements that are bigger—and tinier—than the world has ever seen.

Who are we? We research, develop, and manufacture the world's most advanced inspection and measurement equipment for the semiconductor and nanoelectronics industries. We enable the digital age by pushing the boundaries of technology, creating tools capable of finding defects smaller than a wavelength of visible light. We create smarter processes so that technology leaders can manufacture high-performance chips—the kind in that phone in your pocket, the tablet on your desk and nearly every electronic device you own—faster and better. We're passionate about creating solutions that drive progress and help people do what wouldn't be possible without us. The future is calling. Will you answer?
Group/Division
The Office of the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) plays a critical role in developing advanced long-range technology in collaboration with product divisions and strategic marketing, working on future technology like light sources, lasers, and sensors. We are engaged in the research and development process, and once the technology is mature, we partner with product engineering groups who then build products based on the technology we’ve developed.
The Office of the CTO also provides technical input into KLA’s strategic planning process, program reviews and Product Life Cycle (PLC) phases. We provide our broad technology expertise and cross-division experience to ensure we leverage the collective knowledge within our company.
Responsibilities
This is a R&D position within a dynamic and innovative technology development team, focusing on illumination source technologies required for next generations of wafer inspection and metrology equipment. The main responsibility of this position is to manage all aspects of optical module designs from evaluating initial specifications to validating performance of finished prototypes, including tasks listed below:
As a critical part of CTO SG team, work with scientists in CTO US to gain deep understanding of technology and engineering challenges of illumination sources, such as lasers and broadband plasma.Replicate the proven system from CTO US, run reliability tests and characteristic measurements and use the learnings towards a more robust design.
Work closely with the systems group to develop the fundamental specifications of illumination system and drive down to requirements for optical design, with the consideration of desired system performance, achievable optics capability and other factors.
Design lenses and optical subsystems in ZEMAX or equivalent optical modeling software, including lens elements, multi-lens systems, or other optical components, systems or subsystems. Conduct optical tolerance, aberration, stray light, and sensitivity analyses of optical designs, as necessary.
Design and execute multi-disciplinary experiments, create detailed test plans and summary reports for system performance validation. Analyze experimental data and compare with simulation model for design correlation and optimization.
Create and review specifications, concepts, and design documents throughout the development cycle.
Be an effective communicator and team player while working with other engineering groups, such as laser systems engineer, mechanical design engineer and electric design engineer, to ensure flawless design, integration and test at the subsystem and system level.
Qualifications
Master's level degree in optics engineering or related with at least 8 years of experience or
Doctorate (Academic) in optics engineering or related with at least 5 years of experience
Experience as a direct contributor in optical system design and tolerancing (in Zemax OpticStudio and/or CODE V) from concept to fieldable prototype or product.
Must have experience of aligning, debugging and characterizing optical systems.
Experience with beam shaping design is a plus
Experience with thermal management in high power laser system is a plus
Must be a good team player

Title: #SGUnited Software Engineer (Frontend), Artificial Intellige...
Senior Software Engineer (Python)
Description:
At LenddoEFL we see things differently. We spend our days building products that help make the invisible, visible. Unlike others, we are here to make a social difference and improve the lives of millions.

We offer leading alternative credit scoring, identity verification and insights products to financial institutions in more than 20 emerging markets. To date, LenddoEFL has allowed more than 50 financial institutions to run over 12 million assessments for people with limited information, allowing them to disburse over $2.5 billion USD in credit. We are already changing the world, but we are just getting started.

We have big plans and we are looking to expand our team. Our packages range from US$40k to US$80k depending on the caliber of the candidate.

LOCATION:
We are recruiting for this role in Singapore (SG) and Manilla (PH)

THE ROLE:
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer who has a passion for Python Development. You will work with our team of talented engineers and data scientists to process large datasets for the benefit of applicants of our system. You will work closely with our data science team to implement scoring models and use computer vision to perform eKYC. In this role, you should have excellent organization and problem-solving skills as well as hands-on experience in Python development

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and develop new features that improve our product.
Work with internal and external data sources and API's
Test, debug and maintain the application software throughout the product lifecycle
Ensure quality products using continuous integration and unit testing
Work properly on bugs (and minimizing it) as well as improving application performance.
Innovate through continuously discovering and implementing new technologies

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
4+ years of software development experience
2+ years of Docker experience, 1+ of Kubernetes experience
4+ years of Python Development experience
5+ years of experience with version control solutions (git)
Preference and experience with Python 3

Title: Research Fellow/Research Associate, MERSU
Description:
Post-Doctoral Research Fellow position OR Research Associate for Team-Based Learning (TBL) research in medical education
The Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine (LKCMedicine) uses Team-Based Learning (TBL) as its core pedagogical approach. In short, TBL is student-centred and facilitated by educators, clinicians and scientists. Students work in small teams and start by individually preparing for their session (preparation phase). Once in class, students take both individual and team quizzes to test their understanding of the topic (readiness assurance phase). Lastly, students get the opportunity to apply and test their newly gained understanding by answering a series of Application Exercise (AE) questions (application phase). Teams discuss each AE and discuss their findings with the class.
We are looking for a Post-Doctoral Research Fellow Or Research Associate who has experience with research in active-learning environments, such as TBL or Problem-Based Learning, and who can make a significant contribution to our research programme (note: a background in medical education is not necessarily required).
Responsibilities
Research Fellow:
The primary role of the Post-Doctoral Research Fellow is conducting research on TBL in collaboration with the members of the medical education research team. The main objective of the role is to contribute to the TBL research programme by publishing research findings in high-impact journals.
Research Associate:
The primary role of the Research Associate will be working closely with members of the TBL research team to ensure that all administrative matters are taken care of. In addition, the appointee will assist preparing research materials, protocols, and will be involved in data collection, data analysis, and reporting.
Requirements
Research Fellow:
He or she must have a strong background in research methodology and statistical data analysis;
The candidate must have a publication as first author in a top-tier educational research journal.
The candidate must have a PhD in psychology or education
Research Associate:
Necessary:
Background in education or psychology
Strong background in research methodology and statistical data analysis
Master’s degree in psychology or education
Desirable:
Experience in educational research
Experience in project management
Experience in online data collection techniques (e.g., Qualtrics)
Experience in psychometric analysis of assessment data
Hiring Institution: LKC

Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS QUALITY ASSURANCE TRAINEE ENGINEER
Description:
This position reports to the Senior AI Scientist. As a Quality Assurance Trainee Engineer, you will be tasked to:
Test current products and identifying deficiencies
Suggest solutions to identified product problems
Investigate product quality in order to make improvements to achieve better customer satisfaction
Plan, create and manage the overall Quality Planning strategy
Collaborate with the Product Development team to ensure consistent project execution
Identify quality assurance process bottleneck and suggest actions for improvement
Oversee continuous improvement projects
Collect quality data and identify key KPIs for product quality
Prepare and generate project proposals, test reports and summary reports upon completion of project
Prepare and present reports and metrics to Senior Management
Perform additional ad-hoc duties which may be assigned from time to time by superior

Job Requirements:
Diploma in Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
Working or internship experience in the use of computer language such as C/C++/Go/Python/Java, familiar with data structures, and excellent skills in creating scripts for software and hardware testing
Proactive attitude with the desire to learn new skills, and a problem-solving mindset
Fast learner and passionate about Artificial Intelligence industry and technology
Priority will be given to those who are familiar with testing for smart devices and mobile applications
Fresh graduates from polytechnics are welcome

Title: Software Engineer (Biometrics)
Description:
Location: Singapore, Singapore
In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.
Thales in Singapore has been present since 1973, providing state-of-the-art solutions for customers in the aerospace, defence, security and transportation markets. Today, Thales in Singapore employs over 600 people and is home to all regional avionics services, a ground transportation integration centre, and regional innovation hub.
Responsibilities
The Innovation Labs team is responsible for exploring new technology areas and related opportunities, proposing new ideas and translating new ideas all the way to production.
In this role the Software Engineer will be working within Biometrics and Machine learning area and is responsible for proposing, prototyping proof of concept (POC) of new ideas and implementation of overall solution in line with the best practices so that the POC prototypes can be productized easily.
The new role is suitable for a Data Scientist who has experience in Image Processing and Deep learning. You must have good knowledge on: Image Filtering and Enhancing Techniques, Machine Learning supervised and unsupervised algorithms, Python/R, Spark/Hadoop, one of the Depth learning solutions (Tensor flow, Pytorch, Teano, Caffe, etc.).
The Software Engineer must be able to work with an agile team located at different geographical location. Given the deep knowledge requirements, we are looking for either a phD graduate or someone with experience in a commercial projects.
Requirements
Education: Bachelor/ Master’s Degree – Computer Science or equivalent
PhD Graduate – Image processing and Biometrics related topics
Experience Level: 3+ years’ experience for non-PhD Graduate, with at least 1 year doing Deep Learning.
Strong proficiency in Python/R, Spark/Hadoop, C/C++/Java development
Strong in Image Processing and analytical skills
Experienced with Machine Learning and Deep Learning, familiar with learning techniques, up-to-date with pre-trained models in market.
Good working knowledge of tools such as Git/Mercurial, and Jenkins/Hudson
UNIX/shell scripting, Linux administration.
Experience with agile methodology is preferred
At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

Title: Research Associate (Research Standing Database)
Description:
The Research Associate (RA) will support the Research Standing Database (RSD) project, a collaborative initiative between SGH and SingHealth.

You will be responsible to work closely with data analytics team, stakeholders and external parties with the following key responsibilities:
Development, deployment and maintenance of data protection policies and technical solutions for the governance and safeguarding of privacy and confidentiality all research databases, as well as institutional integrity, under prevailing regulations and institutional policies (including the Human Biomedical Research Act and the Personal Data Protection Act amongst others).
Develop and document the solution architectures and solution requirements and, when needed, define end user proof-of-concept/MVPs for pilot solutions, usage models and corresponding technologies in test bed or end user environments.
Work with end users, implementation scientists and ecosystem partners to deploy those solutions, collect data and evaluate outcomes in early pilot implementation environments.
Auto req ID
6638BR
Job Requirements
Masters in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or any related computational disciplines or equivalent.
At least 1 year of technical solutions experience in a relevant data science area
Familiarity with healthcare database management systems and processes as well as healthcare data governance policies and regulation will be an advantage.
Ability to construct conceptual, logical, and physical data models across database platforms, i.e., Traditional RDBMS, Big Data (Hive, HBase), Object Store, and file formats
Knowledge of major programming/scripting language is required (e.g., R/Python, Java, Javascript, Ruby, Julia, PHP).
Knowledge of interfacing with RESTful APIs, cloud services, GitHub
Evidence in strong logical reasoning, inferential and deductive capabilities will be a definite advantage
Has strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and ability to work with incomplete or imperfect data
Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
Effective team player who is able to collaborate with members of inter-professional functions, effectively contribute and be adaptive within multidisciplinary teams
Organized, meticulous and able to work independently and in a team.

Research
Job Function
Biomedical Engineering, Engineering, Information Technology, Research & Development
Employment Type
Contract Full Time
Location
Singapore
Education Level

Title: Sr/Scientist
Description:
Basic Function and Scope of the Position:
Provide technical support to the manufacturing process development and improvements in a high volume manufacturing environment. Major role in analytical methods development, process characterization and new products introduction.
Tasks and Responsibilities:
Participates in process sustaining, definition and improvement, design, development and quality test activities.
Participates in establishing operating process, equipment specifications and improvements.
Troubleshoots production line issues related to yield, quality and throughput.
Constructs and executes experiments to address yield and quality issues and drives implementation of solutions in a production environment to meet production goals.
Conducts process optimization experiments for process release into production environment. Analyzes process test results, issues reports and makes technical recommendations.
Works cross functionally with R&D, Manufacturing and Quality to develop processes for new products and improve processes of existing products.
Defines technical requirements and procedures for manufacturing to process product.
Ensures system and process equipment are in compliance with corporate quality system and regulatory requirements.
Executions of training plan across functions.
Leads or supports development of key strategic program, complete design and engineering projects within schedule, budget and quality constraints.
Provides guidance to junior engineers.
All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.
Preferred Educational Background:
Ph.D. in Synthesis Chemistry, Material Science, Chemistry, Protein Engineering, Biochemistry, Analytical Chemistry, Chemical/Biochemical Engineering and/or Bio-related discipline.
Preferred Experiential Background:
5 - 8 years’ of relevant experience required.
Strong project management skills.
Work experience in the biotech industries is strongly preferred.
Proficiency with chemical processes and analyses.
Experience in a high-tech, high-volume consumables manufacturing industry.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail required.
Competencies:
Dealing with and managing change.
Good Documentation Practices and ability to write procedures and training manual.
Basic computer troubleshooting.
Good inter-departmental communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to work independently.
Statistical Process Control knowledge and DOE techniques.
Analyze data and make logical and rational conclusion.
Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

Title: Bioprocess Scientist (Fermentation)
Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Opportunity: The scientist will use his/her skills in research and process development, and be part of an enthusiastic entrepreneurial community. This position has been designed for the individual to benefit from the resources available, conduct microbial cell line development for the pilot and large scale production of recombinant products. This position will expose the individual to a fast paced and exciting environment, allowing the individual to acquire lateral / domain expertise and grow with the company.

The Scope: The scientist will perform research and process development activities in collaboration with other stakeholders (academics, corporate partners, contract research organizations, customers) such as-
Independent operation of pilot and industrial scale fermentation/upstream process equipment following GLP/GMP guidelines and able to troubleshoot operational and equipment issues
Identify, recommend and implement process and operational improvements of upstream process while maintaining safe operations
Run associated downstream equipment
Demonstrate technical competence utilizing detailed knowledge of standard analytical techniques in fermentation process development and data analysis.
Completing required document for SOPs, operational training and safety training.
Opportunities to work with collaborators on other sites
Job Responsibilities: The Scientist will be able to work independently and work on problems of diverse scope requiring analysis of data and evaluation of identifiable factors. He/she will develop expert knowledge of scientific principles and concepts, provide detailed data, results, analyses, and summary reports to management, and recommend paths forward based on analysis. He/she must demonstrate technical proficiency, scientific creativity, and independent thought. [CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE WORK PASSES NEED NOT APPLY]

[CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE WORK PASSES NEED NOT APPLY]

Title: VP, Senior Data Analyst/Scientist, Digital Bank
Description:
About UOBUnited Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.About the DepartmentYou will be part of a very vibrant and dynamic team at the heart of the new UOB Digital Bank that is innovating the way the customers engage with bank through the most customized experiences possible. In joining the Engagement Lab as a Data Scientist, you’ll be in a key role that helps deepen the customer interactions by applying advanced data analytics.
We will be expecting you to have extensive experiences in data science and analytics field – developing models, rules and algorithms from structured and unstructured sources and performing deep-dive analysis to derive data-driven decisions.
Job Responsibilities• Apply statistical tools/models to perform advanced data analytics, identify key underlying drivers for growing customer engagement and business opportunities, and recommend a clear action plan going forward.
Develop and implement artificial intelligence algorithms, rules and rapid prototypes from big data sets that will be fed into various business programs.
Behavioral segmentation based on customer journey, profiles, transaction patterns, and app activities that will lead to highly personalized customer insights.
Design and monitor A/B testing and various engagement activities.
Perform deep-dive analysis to solve various business problems arising from marketing, dynamic incentive programs, and campaign management.
Build and automate intuitive dashboards that help visualize and answer complex business problems.
Job Requirements• Analytical mind with sound business insights. Ability to translate the business problems and requirements into analytics solutions.
Knowledge of a variety of predictive models, machine learning algorithms and statistical techniques, e.g. logistic regression, decision tree, clustering, neural networks, support vector machines, principal component analytics, natural language processing.
Knowledge of CRM platforms, campaign management, and A/B testing.
Experience in Adobe Analytics / Adobe Campaign is a plus.
Proficiency across the core statistical toolsets (SQL, SAS, R, Python), data visualization tools (Tableau, Qlik) and Hadoop ecosystem.
In-depth knowledge of digital banking, banking products and the overall industry a strong plus
Good verbal and written communication skills.
University degree, preferably in computer science, engineering or analytical discipline, e.g. mathematics, statistics, IT, economics, finance, accounting.
Minimum 3 years working experience in data analytics or business intelligence units, preferably in financial industry.
Self-motivated. Can-do spirit.
Be a part of UOB FamilyApply now and make a difference.

Title: Scientist I, Molecular Biology
Description:
How Will You Make an Impact?

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $25 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 75,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.

What will you do?

The Scientist I (contract) will be heavily involved in the execution of molecular biology tests designed by the senior group members for feasibility as well as verification and validation of new assays and instruments. Ability to design and execute simple experiments independently and report the results will also be required. The new hire will be primarily based in laboratory and as such, will have strong experience in Molecular Biological techniques and be comfortable in this environment. The Scientist I will work effectively as part of a dynamic team or alone and possess strong organization skills. The successful applicant is required to exhibit results-oriented attitude with the ability to thrive in the fast-paced environment.

How will you get here?

I. Education
Bachelors or Masters in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry or similar

II. Experience
Possesses prior laboratory experience in PCR, qPCR, gel electrophoresis. Knowledge of NGS and capillary electrophoresis is preferred.
Possesses strong computer skills and can manage and analyze data sets.

III. Knowledge, Skills, Abilities

Executes molecular biology experiments independently and performs accurate record keeping.
Accurately follows protocols
Assists senior members of the team in complex experimentation planning and execution.
Exercises independent judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action.
Adheres to company policies and procedures following research and development scientific standards.

Title: Data Application Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
Who are we ?
Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we're enjoying skyrocketing growth.
Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients' specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we've acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.
We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.
To support and develop its growth, Artefact is looking for the next talents of the data divizion to join the engineering team. Organized in feature team, you will work in project mode (ou pizza team) to advise your clients on their IA problematics, machine learning and Big Data. The projects you will work on can go from the migration of infrastructure to the Cloud (Deezer) to the construction of a predictive model of the water rises (Greenpeace).
Your responsibilities:
Innovate. You will work with your team which is made up of consultants, data scientists, creatives and engineers to identify your clients needs and define innovatives solutions.
Build. You'll take ownership of the solution from start to end. You manage both conception and implementation, while also optimising the performance and scalability.
Train. You will work in a collaborative team which champions knowledge sharing. You will coach others, keep abreast of industry news/updates and get stuck into training sessions with our business partners and suppliers, such as Google & Amazon.
Communication. You will regularly attend events and conferences to share your knowledge, learnings and success, with the capability of presenting and communicating
Your mindset
Curious, you are always seeking innovative solutions for your clients. You are involved in all the value chain which can be, front-end, back-end, big data infrastructure, ML model …
Sharing of knowledge is essential for you and you actively participate in the diffusion of information within Artefact (seminaries, formations, certifications)
Entrepreneurial, you bring solutions, new ideas, within your team at Artefact
Profile :
You act on all the value chain of projects (infrastructures and platforms creation, data collection, application of machine learning models, APIs REST creations, of front-ends, of tests, continuous deployments)
Your studies involved software engineering, and you have experience in DevOps
You know how to set up and deploy NLP model provided by our data scientists
You are a ninja in the use and exploitation of data bus like Kafka of PubSub
You practiced indexation system such as ElasticSearch and Vespa
You have a good knowledge of python, you are really interested in the command line *nix, you are familiar or have already used cloud technologies such as GCP or AWS, you have already used big data technologies like Flink, Spark, or Beam and Docker (K8S is an asset)
You can popularize technical terms or solutions to more business oriented profiles, you can work in a team with very diversified profiles
You know how to prioritize your tasks, respect deadlines, prevent in case of problems
You can manage a team, coach juniors, identify their axes of progress
You can anticipate risks projects, you moderate risks when choosing for a technology
You have a good level of english
Why join us :
Innovative projects and technologies, exciting
Really competent team, co-progression guaranteed
Strong ambition for the data department, full of progression opportunities (technical, management)
Recent Stack : Python, Spark, React/Redux, Google Cloud Platform (BQ, Dataflow, Compute Engine…), Nifi, HDFS, Ansible, Docker, Redis, ...
Come join us !
#SING

Title: VP, Data Translator & Project Specialist, Operational Risk M...
Description:
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.

Job Purpose

The Technology & Operations Group is key to enabling the DBS vision of being the best bank in the world. The key mandate of T&O Ops Risk Management (T&O ORM) – Risk Analytics is to drive a data-driven risk management culture and establish the analytics capabilities across T&O Risk and Control. A major initiative is to setup the Ops Risk Management Control Tower comprising a Central Risk Intelligence platform that allows key operational risk data to be a collated, curated and transformed for interactive digital metrics, self-service business intelligence and advance analytics solution to enable more proactive risk management.

About the role

The Data Translator is required to support the translation of business problems into the analytics use cases, and provide project management and business analysis and visualization support to deliver the use cases, together with the relevant analytics experts and application technology support. The incumbent is accountable for the delivery of control tower initiatives and solutions for T&O ORM, to enable the transformation of T&O risk management in using data for risk management.

Responsibilities
Drive the transformation of the Ops risk metrics and relevant processes in T&O as part of the Control Tower strategy
Provide data translation and business analysis coaching to risk SMEs and explore opportunities for further data piping & new risk metrics
Liaise with the relevant stakeholders and technology support as needed for the implementation and support
Partner T&O RM SMEs & Ops stakeholders on transformation initiatives & requirements
o Collaborate with Subject-Matter-Experts to assess business needs and translate into analytics use cases
o Collaborate with data analyst & scientist to address data & analytics solutions
o Manage the delivery of the use cases with relevant stakeholders
o Provide prompt updates and identification/resolution/escalation of initiatives to management / stakeholders
Requirements
Degree holder in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent with minimum 12-16 years of working experience
Minimum 6-8 years of data mining and/or machine learning, dealing with large amount of data
Minimum 6-8 years of relevant project management and/or business analyst experience in managing and implementing analytics solutions of various scale and scope
Knowledge and experience in analytics processes, software tools and agile methodology
Knowledge and experience in human-centred design methodology will be preferred
Strong project management and stakeholder management skills
Strong analytical skills including the ability to translate business problems and requirements into analytics use cases
General banking knowledge and familiarity with use of analytics
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
Independent self-starter with ability to multitask and has a ‘can-do’ attitude
Proficient in data management and analysis, and able to present analysis in a manner accessible by non-statisticians through data visualisation techniques
Programming or management experience in SQL query, SAS, R, or other statistical software is useful
Apply Now


We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Title: Digital Application Developer
Description:
Digital Application Developer
Singapore
Step out of your comfort zone, excel and redefine the limits of what is possible. That’s just what our employees are doing every single day – in order to set the pace through our innovations and enable outstanding achievements. After all, behind every successful company are many great fascinating people.
We are looking for people who are keen to try something new:
You are passionate about artificial intelligence and want to work on challenging projects which have a big impact, then join our team and help us to revolutionize the manufacturing industry. Come and contribute directly to make our products smarter and our customers successful.
If you would like to work with a world class team of distinguished scientists and engineers who are revolutionizing the field of optics and imaging, then we have just the opening for you.

Your Role
Responsible for development of software applications as part of the ZEISS team at the Center of Excellence, consisting of exceptional engineers and researchers
Engage closely with the IME department of A*Star to understand the end user needs in the semi-conductor industry
Work proactively with IME to translate their needs into software functionalities and define new functionalities
Develop, test and improve working modules together with the I²R department of A*star and pre-pare the modules for integration into the ZEISS digital solutions products
Support software product definition and development with expertise in artificial intelligence and big data processing
Work with I²R, IME and ecosystem partners to deploy those solutions in early adopter production environments
Key Qualifications
Masters Degree and/or PhD degree in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering
At least 3 years of work experience in relevant fields of Image Visualization, Image Processing, Data Processing and machine learning
Professional experience in a commercial environment with Matlab, Python, R, C#/.NET, WPF, XAML, and Visual Studio
Experience with 2D/3D toolkits such as OpenGL, ImageJ, or OpenCV programming environments
Experience with applications at scale and handling large datasets is preferred
Experience working closely with development teams and clients to scope technical requirements and produce design for implementation
Experience with imaging systems, lithography, process control will be highly valued
In a spacious modern setting full of opportunities for further development, ZEISS employees work in a place where expert knowledge and team spirit reign supreme. All of this is supported by a special ownership structure and the long-term goal of the Carl Zeiss Foundation: to bring science and society into the future together.

Join us today. Inspire people tomorrow.

Diversity is a part of ZEISS. We look forward to receiving your application regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion, philosophy of life, disability, age, sexual orientation or identity.

Apply now! It takes less than 10 minutes.

Title: Research Officer (Ref: NHCS/RO/HY)
Description:
You will be part of a research team under the MedTech theme at the National Heart Research Institute Singapore (NHRIS). You will be interacting with clinicians, cardiologists, scientists and engineers to drive specific research and development projects focused primarily on the treatment of cardiovascular diseases using minimally invasive approaches. You will perform laboratory duties such as culture and equipment maintenance, media preparation, autoclaving, housekeeping of the laboratory, proper storage and labelling of chemicals and waste handling. You will support the achievement of research goals and direction in line with NHRIS’ Key Performance Indicators. You will assist the Core Scientific Lead or Principal Investigator to analyse, collate and compile research data for publication. You will also upkeep and maintain documentations related to projects such as grant submissions, ethics submissions, standard operating procedures, core access forms, quality reports etc. The selected candidate will be offered employment on 1-year renewable contractual terms.

5816BR
Job Requirements
Degree or Master in Biomedical Engineering, Material Science & Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or equivalent
Experience in product design/FEA/Prototyping
Experience in cardiovascular field and medical devices will be an advantage
Able to work independently as well as in team

Title: SVP / VP, Solution Architect Big Data Analytics (CMP), Group...
Description:
Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.

At DBS, we see ourselves as a 22,000 people start up, leveraging start up thinking while relying on the latest innovation to design and develop technology solutions for our customers and people.
We’re looking for technologists across varying levels all over the world to be part of a major transformation programme to reimagine banking.

Based in Singapore, you’ll be leveraging the latest technology to develop mission critical applications from scratch, using Big Data and other OpenSource technologies, Microservices, cloud technologies, Agile and DevOps

Responsibilities
Define and own end to end architecture for Big Data Analytics Solutions for Consumer Banking Group. Drive our data analytics and ML application architecture.
Engage with business analysts, marketing, operations teams in Consumer Banking Group to understand their needs and create big data analytics solutions that meet the business needs
You will work closely with Big Data Engineering and Data Science team to implement, troubleshoot, and optimise distributed applications based on modern big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc. in both an on premise and cloud deployment model to solve large scale processing problems.
Lead the transformation of a peta-byte scale batch-based processing platform to a near real-time streaming platform using technologies such as Kafka and Spark.
Transition several 100’s of existing applications (based in Teradata, Informatica, Qlik View, SAS based analytics and ML models) to modern big data analytics applications based on Hadoop, Spark, Kafka etc
Well versed with Data Sciences, Machine learning and Deep Learning based solutions and frameworks. Apply technical knowledge to architect solutions that meet business and IT needs infusing key analytics and ML technologies where appropriate
Provide expert level support to data scientists, data engineers, and operations to deliver high quality analytics, machine learning data pipelines, APIs and end to end solutions.
Maintain and advance deep technical skills and knowledge, keeping up to date with market trends and competitive insights, and share within the technical community
Develop deep relationships with key business stakeholders and decision makers to drive cloud adoption within their company to enable them to be cloud advocates

Requirements
Technical Degree, min of bachelor’s in computer science or adjacent fields with 15+ years of software development experience
10+ years of expertise in Big Data technologies including Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Hadoop, No-SQL databases such as HBase, Cassandra, OLAP columnar storage systems, Bit Map indexes to handle millions of consumers and thousands of attributes while allowing real-time querying and segmentation
Must have hands on coding skills in Java or Python
Experience in building data services and applications on both structured and unstructured streaming data
Experience in operationalising Machine Learning workflows to scale
Breadth of technical experience and expertise in Business Intelligence, Big Data and Data Science
Proven track record of driving architecture decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through with exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences (Senior Executives, IT management and engineers)
Hunger to Learn & Teach – Genuine interest to learn new technologies and share it with rest of the engineering team to keep them up to date on technology trends.
Problem solver – Enjoy new and meaningful technology or business challenges which require you to think and respond quickly
Open source – Prefer open source technologies and build it yourself mentality, open source contribution is highly preferred.
Team player – Enjoy working collaboratively with a talented group of people to tackle challenging business problems so we all succeed (or fail fast) as a team
Ability to travel up to 25% of the time
Experience with big data analytics and data science solutions developed in large cloud computing infrastructures such as Amazon Web Services, Azure Cloud, and/or Google Cloud
Prior experience as a data architect in designing large, complex enterprise data environments, for both structured and unstructured data. Expertise in data modelling, data governance, data mastering, meta-data management, data security and compliance, data lifecycle management, data-tiering and data archiving
Presence in open source projects will be huge plus.
Experience with Personalisation, Recommendation, Audience Segmentation systems

Title: Data Product Team
Description:
Job Description
We are looking for a talented Data Engineer to join our growing team. You will be responsible for expanding our data collection as well as optimizing data pipelines for cross-functional teams. Ideally, you are an experienced engineer who enjoys optimizing data pipeline and building them from scratch. You will support business analysts, software engineers, and data scientists and ensure optimal on-time delivery of ongoing projects. You will be a self-starter and thrive in supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems, and products. Experience in e-commerce industry will be a plus.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Build both batch and streaming data pipeline for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using big data technologies

Deliver data projects to support customer acquisition, operational efficiency, campaign and other key business performance metrics

Monitor & manage data pipelines, ensuring accuracy and stability

Diagnose, analyse and provide solutions to issues in scripts, reports, tools, data, etc.

Work with stakeholders and sort out data-related issues

Identify, design and implement improvements, e.g. automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing architecture for greater scalability, etc.

Provide on-call support on a roster basis
Job Requirements
Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or similar

5+ years of relevant working experience

Familiar with Hadoop big data platform architecture: HDFS/HBase/Hive/MapReduce, proficient in Hive SQL, understand real-time computing, and have previous experience in using open source real-time streaming engines such as Flink and Spark Streaming

Familiar with dimensional data modelling, and data warehouse concepts and methodologies as well as distributed processing systems

Experience with programming and understanding of basic algorithms

Previous experience in building reports via reporting tools is a plus

E-commerce experience is a plus

Attention to details and strong problem-solving skills

Respect diversity and different cultures

Excellent communication skills

Title: Sr/Scientist
Description:
Basic Function and Scope of the Position:
Provide technical support to the manufacturing process development and improvements in a high volume manufacturing environment. Major role in analytical methods development, process characterization and new products introduction.
Tasks and Responsibilities:
Participates in process sustaining, definition and improvement, design, development and quality test activities.
Participates in establishing operating process, equipment specifications and improvements.
Troubleshoots production line issues related to yield, quality and throughput.
Constructs and executes experiments to address yield and quality issues and drives implementation of solutions in a production environment to meet production goals.
Conducts process optimization experiments for process release into production environment. Analyzes process test results, issues reports and makes technical recommendations.
Works cross functionally with R&D, Manufacturing and Quality to develop processes for new products and improve processes of existing products.
Defines technical requirements and procedures for manufacturing to process product.
Ensures system and process equipment are in compliance with corporate quality system and regulatory requirements.
Executions of training plan across functions.
Leads or supports development of key strategic program, complete design and engineering projects within schedule, budget and quality constraints.
Provides guidance to junior engineers.
All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.
Preferred Educational Background:
Ph.D. in Synthesis Chemistry, Material Science, Chemistry, Protein Engineering, Biochemistry, Analytical Chemistry, Chemical/Biochemical Engineering and/or Bio-related discipline.
Preferred Experiential Background:
5 - 8 years’ of relevant experience required.
Strong project management skills.
Work experience in the biotech industries is strongly preferred.
Proficiency with chemical processes and analyses.
Experience in a high-tech, high-volume consumables manufacturing industry.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail required.
Competencies:
Dealing with and managing change.
Good Documentation Practices and ability to write procedures and training manual.
Basic computer troubleshooting.
Good inter-departmental communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to work independently.
Statistical Process Control knowledge and DOE techniques.
Analyze data and make logical and rational conclusion.

Title: Bioprocess Scientist (Fermentation)
Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Opportunity: The scientist will use his/her skills in research and process development, and be part of an enthusiastic entrepreneurial community. This position has been designed for the individual to benefit from the resources available, conduct microbial cell line development for the pilot and large scale production of recombinant products. This position will expose the individual to a fast paced and exciting environment, allowing the individual to acquire lateral / domain expertise and grow with the company.

The Scope: The scientist will perform research and process development activities in collaboration with other stakeholders (academics, corporate partners, contract research organizations, customers) such as-
Independent operation of pilot and industrial scale fermentation/upstream process equipment following GLP/GMP guidelines and able to troubleshoot operational and equipment issues
Identify, recommend and implement process and operational improvements of upstream process while maintaining safe operations
Run associated downstream equipment
Demonstrate technical competence utilizing detailed knowledge of standard analytical techniques in fermentation process development and data analysis.
Completing required document for SOPs, operational training and safety training.
Opportunities to work with collaborators on other sites
Job Responsibilities: The Scientist will be able to work independently and work on problems of diverse scope requiring analysis of data and evaluation of identifiable factors. He/she will develop expert knowledge of scientific principles and concepts, provide detailed data, results, analyses, and summary reports to management, and recommend paths forward based on analysis. He/she must demonstrate technical proficiency, scientific creativity, and independent thought. [CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE WORK PASSES NEED NOT APPLY]
