Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS PRINCIPAL PROJECT MANAGER
Description:
Principal Project Manager
TranSwap is among the promising early-stage FinTech investment opportunities in South-East Asia. Recognised by Tech In Asia (2018), it is one of the Top 4 FinTech Startups out of more than 250 promising startups. Since 2015, TranSwap has demonstrated tremendous potential to grow outside of Singapore, notably making inroads into Hong Kong, Indonesia and expanding its outreach in South-East Asia. TranSwap offers a Cross-Border Payments Platform for businesses & individuals to seamlessly manage and execute payments across 120 currencies to more than 160 countries globally. We are able to provide the most competitive rates through our wide network of FX Partners, and our proprietary online transaction portal enables businesses to fulfil overseas payments with minimal associated FX costs and complexity.

We are looking for a Principal Project Manager (PM) to drive technology innovation. This PM will partner with treasury and operations colleagues to come up with a vision and plans to get us there. The PM will create and manage a roadmap which balances short and long-term needs and maximizes opportunities to learn and gather feedback. The PM will also lead & manage the scrum teams including engineering and data science, where the teams are based in Vietnam, Thailand, Indonesia & Hong Kong. The PM will manage the teams’ work, estimate the complexity and size, determine the technical design (within architectural guidelines) and contribute to the continuous improvement of the agile teams. To be successful in this role, the PM will need to act as a thought partner on how to transform Transwap business solutions not only technology, but the business processes around it.

Responsibilities:
Establish shared vision with the teams on how technology will help accelerate and enhance our business solutions & products for our clients
Manage roadmap and communicate regularly to key stakeholders about plans, timelines, and status
Drive remote scrum teams including engineers, data scientists, and analysts to create prototypes and build enterprise business solutions / products
Deeply understand customer and user needs using a range of UX research methodologies
Track external technologies or vendor solutions which could help the team achieve its goals; run vendor selection processes as appropriate
Track adoption and effectiveness of products using quantitative data and qualitative feedback
Continually improve development processes using Agile methodologies
Requirements:
Relevant Bachelor's or Master's degree;
At least 8 years of experience in Product Management with strong track record of successful product delivery, preferably in the financial banking payments and corporate treasury space;
Exceptional communication and engagement skills with the ability to inspire and motivate change;
Skill at managing stakeholder groups (internal & external) with tact, assertiveness and diplomacy;
Excellent analytical ability
Ability to work independently
Rigorous prioritization and time management
Experience managing an agile development process, preferably with experience in full-stack development.
Familiarity with Agile delivery methodologies such as SAFE and RPA solution design
Frequent overseas travel to manage the remote scrum teams is required
Ability to speak some foreign languages (e.g. Vietnamese, Thai, Bahasa Indonesia) is a plus.

Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS MANUFACTURING DESIGN ENGINEER (EBEAM – CONTAMI...
Description:
Responsibilities:
Strong analytical skills in evaluating GC/MS and RGA results to understand the contamination causes to implement process improvements.
Setting up and conducting material outgassing and materials experimental work, including setting up procedures, performing experiments, and keeping records of experiments
Set up high vacuum systems and high purity inert gas chambers with analytical instrumentation.
Collecting and analyzing data. Review data for accuracy and completeness. Extract clear results from large, complex data sets. Give effective technical reports up to the Product Life Cycle (PLC) level
Work with suppliers globally to define and/or improve manufacturing processes on critical modules and commodities that are highly sensitive to both particle and organic contamination which operates in ultra-high vacuum environment.
Work with other scientist groups such as photo contamination scientists, laser scientists and material experts for risk assessments and to ensure their feasibilities for KLA products
Establish well written procedures and protocols for GC/MS VOC test method.
Requirements:
PhD or Master/Bachelor in material science, chemistry, chemical engineering, or related field is required. Relevant industry experience a plus.
Entry level Doctorate or Masters candidates with strong relevant technical knowledge, and/or relevant instrument hands-on experience is welcomed.
Experience working in an analytical chemistry laboratory. Multi-disciplinary knowledge of GC/MS, RGA, mass spectroscopy, lab automation, and software are required.
Experience in process flow development in an manufacturing setup
Strong fundamental knowledge in chemistry, chemical laboratory practices and surface science.
Electron optics experience will be a plus.
Able to read technical drawings, understand BOMs, and use a variety of precision testing and measuring instruments, such as microscope and white light interferometer
Strong problem-solving ability through design of experiments and carry out tests to collect and analyze data. Able to apply the 7-Step problem solving method consistently.
Team player with good communication skills

Title: Assistant Scientist CBRNE (Contract based)
Company: Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX)
Description:
Job Scope:
Conduct daily sampling, study and perform test on bio or non-bio related material using instruments such as microarray or RT PCR test
Competent to perform basic set of laboratory SOPs
To perform COVID-19 screening and other biological test
To conduct sampling in outdoor environment as and when required
To perform daily operation and maintenance of the laboratory instruments, detectors and equipment
Willing to be cross-trained to perform chemical analysis using LCMS and GCMS
To conduct practical training and demonstration to uniform officers as and when required
To perform ad-hoc screening of samples in laboratory as and when required
Optimisation and validation of new analytical methods for analysis of new compounds/ substances
Devise evaluation methodology and execute laboratory evaluation of new scientific equipment and instrument
Participate in the establishment of testing specifications and validation of testing methods for audit and accreditation
Collect and analyze data for optimization of system performance and troubleshooting
Management of laboratory inventories such as consumables and equipment
Procurement of laboratory consumables and equipment
Perform additional duties as required or assigned by supervisors
Assist in housekeeping of laboratories


Job Requirements:
Tertiary qualifications in Science in Biology/ Bio-Engineering/ Biomedical Science / Biotechnology. Background in molecular biology would be ideal
Good command of English (at least a “B” and above for GCE ‘O’ Level English is required)
Possess written and oral communications skills and ability to communicate scientific information clearly to non-experts
Proficient in basic Microsoft Office skills, such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Experience in RNA extraction and/or RT-PCR will be an advantage
Able to perform 12 hour shift work and return to lab on exigent of service


Personal Characteristics & Behaviour:
Candidate must be someone who takes initiative and willing to take on extra responsibilities
Candidate must be meticulous, enthusiastic, inquisitive and patient
Independent good team player

This is a contract role. More details will be shared during the interview.

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Description:
We’re BCG Digital Ventures. Are you open to the adventure of a lifetime?
Our mission is to invent, launch, scale and invest in game-changing businesses with the world’s most influential corporations. We launch a new business every month and we have the backing of one of the world’s leading consultancy firms: the Boston Consulting Group. We combine BCG’s resources and domain expertise with our diverse, global team of accomplished designers, engineers, product experts and business strategists to launch ventures in many different industries, incorporating groundbreaking technologies such as blockchain or machine learning. All of us are entrepreneurs at heart, seeking to move quickly and nimbly in order to find new ways of delivering value to our customers.
Engineering at BCGDV
Our multidisciplinary engineering team tackles challenges at their core. From product and test engineers to full stack engineers and data scientists, our venture builders all share a passion for innovative and emerging digital solutions. Working in collaboration with product and design teams, they use cutting-edge and custom technologies to imagine, build and launch breakthrough digital businesses that disrupt markets and generate untold value for businesses and consumers alike.
About The Role
As a full stack engineer you will be a valued member of a multi-skilled venture team, building disruptive and innovative products and businesses. We operate in a truly agile fashion, so you will get to deliver working software to customers daily and learn from the results. You will bring your experience and skill to bear on the multitude of new and exciting challenges that appear when trying to bring a new product or business to market. Is this an exciting adventure that you’d like to be part of?
What You’ll Do
Grow innovative, groundbreaking products and business that address real customer frictions
Learn how to found, grow and operate successful startups
Design and architect innovative, modern architectures
Lead the technical development for large areas of a product
Support and mentor junior engineers
Write code as part of a diverse and multi-skilled development team
Champion a focus on software qualities such as testability, security, scalability, operability etc
Work with state of the art technologies to solve genuine, real-world problems
Champion good agile practices that provide a foundation for iterative product development
Build strong relationships with product managers, venture architects and designers
Enjoy working in a diverse, dynamic, collaborative, transparent, environment where everyone's ideas and opinions are equally valued
Contribute to the growth of the DV Singapore Engineering cohort
Demonstrate and communicate a passion for implementing highly scalable and maintainable backend services
Share technical solutions and product ideas through design review, pair programming, code review and technological discussions
What You’ll Bring
Hands-on development and delivery experience with a broad mix of languages and technologies
Real passion for solving customer frictions through simple and effective software
Strong people skills that contribute to an open and collaborative environment
Experience working with Agile, Lean and Continuous Delivery approaches, such as Continuous Integration, TDD, Infrastructure as Code etc.
Experience in communicating ideas and decisions to a variety of team members
Experience building cloud native software architectures
An ability to embrace and reduce uncertainty through continual validated learning
Building great software at web scale requires a multidisciplinary approach to engineering. It is far more important to be able to reason intelligently about complex problems, and apply experience to new domains than it is to know specifics about the newest technology buzzword
Below are the technologies we primarily use for front end development. However, we'll always choose the best tool for the job (maybe you can suggest one?), so don't consider this list either exhaustive or immutable:
Languages / Frameworks
Front End: HTML5, CSS3, SASS, React, Redux, Progressive Web Applications
Back End: Ruby/Rails, Go, Python, JavaScript
Infrastructure
Docker, Kubernetes, Amazon Web Services, AWS Lambda
About BCGDV
BCG Digital Ventures is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law.

Title: Retention Programs Manager, APAC
Description:
Do you love a challenge and find yourself looking for innovative ways to solve problems? Do you approach each project with an open mind asking the question what if? Then read on. The focus of this role will be to collaborate, develop & execute on strategic initiatives & programs with the Autodesk ecosystem to help maximize retention results for the Global Renewals Team, Customer Success Teams, Midmarket Sales teams and channel partners. This role will report directly to the Sr. Director of Global Renewals, Customer Success Organization.

Responsibilities
Work closely with Customer Success Organization, APAC Territory Sales, Business Strategy & Marketing, Digital Subscriber Success Team, Partner Management teams, Global Sales Operations, and the Digital Sales Teams to coordinate, develop, & deploy short term and long-term GEO and Global retention programs
Manage all aspects of program development & execution for assigned retention programs, including:
Collect input from stakeholder teams, including Customer Success Renewals teams, Territory Sales & Channel Management
Scope, create and manage program elements, including sourcing tools & resources required to execute
Review plans and solicit feedback from stakeholder teams, such as CSO, sales, partner management and partners
Solicit & manage contributions from CSO, sales, BSM, partner teams and operational groups
Communicate programs using established communication mediums, including email, webinars, newsletter submissions and participating on team calls
Coordinate with retention Analyst to forecast, track & measure results compared to forecast on a cadence agreed to by program sponsors, and raises alerts about potential issues
Leverage historic performance and team input to develop budgets & forecasts for the program
Suggest and implement recommended improvements to address issues that arise
Post-mortem analysis & recommendations to be used in future campaign development
Perform ad-hoc analysis as required to support programs and/or assigned business objectives, including:
Work closely with data teams to identify appropriate data sources for analysis, and collect/download data from internal systems
Apply critical thinking to validate data and results, applying attention to detail
Identify key takeaways from the analysis and communicate in written, oral and presentation formats
Innovate where no solution has been previously identified to answer complex business problems
Assist in Go To Market planning and execution of programs and processes:
Contributing to program strategy, design, development and implementation
Assist with preparing and delivering presentations in support of the program objectives
Evangelize programs with internal teams (Partner Management, Sales, Marketing, Sales Operations, Customer Success, Data Analytic Organizations) and external teams (VAR, VAD, Volume, Digital Direct)

Minimum Qualifications
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent
Min 8+ years in marketing, sales, or program management
Experience in developing, implementing and communicating strategic programs & initiatives
Key Business Skills
Strong collaboration, teamwork and influencing skills
Excellent program management and follow-through skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills at all levels of an organization
Knowledge and understanding of Autodesk products and the various business models
Flexible approach to people, projects, and assignments
Ability to work independently and collaborate successfully with remote individuals, and teams
Highly organized and able to maintain clarity in changing environments
Self-motivated and excellent problem-solving skills as well as a team-oriented attitude
Skilled in Microsoft office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)
Critical Skills
Demonstrated aptitude to learn new skills quickly
Ability to work independently, with limited direction, strong self-management and follow through skills
Excellent problem-solving skills with an aptitude to learn new ways of thinking
Exceptional critical thinking skills with an attention to details
Travel as required

About Autodesk
With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It's disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital scientists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider employment for all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.
To all recruitment agencies: Autodesk does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Autodesk will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Autodesk, Inc.

Title: Data Science Researcher (Python / Spark / Hadoop)
Description:
Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
Highly Collaborative Environment
About Our Client
Our client is an Artificial Intelligence Platform and they are looking for a highly analytical Data Science Researcher (Python / Spark / Hadoop) to explore huge datasets from various environments and apply state of the art AI/ML techniques to solve real world business problems.
Job Description
As the Data Science Researcher (Python / Spark / Hadoop), you are responsible for:
Engaging with clients and identifying key problem statements in the areas of risk, fraud or natural language processing (NLP).
Researching and experimenting with state-of-the-art machine learning (ML) / AI algorithms to solve said key problem statements.
Driving continuous functionality and feature improvements of the AI products.
Collaborating with other research scientists and engineers to formulate innovative solutions to implement advanced AI techniques and taking them to production.
The Successful Applicant
As a successful applicant, you will have a PhD in Computer Science or equivalent with minimum of 2 years of experience in the Data Science domain, backed by a good track record of working on Anomaly Detection and Clustering use cases. You will also be an expert with Python as a programming language, backed by a strong understanding of Big Data infrastructure technologies such as Spark / Hadoop etc.
You will have a strong background in Natural Language Processing (NLP), coupled with relevant working experience in Graph databases and Graph algorithms.
What's on Offer
Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
Highly Collaborative Environment
Attractive Salary Package

Title: Data Scientist (Python / AWS)
Description:
Opportunity to work with Advance Technologies
Leading the Data-Driven Culture
About Our Client
Our client is one of the Market Leaders in the Shipping Industry and they are looking for a Data Scientist (Python / AWS) to build analytics solutions that will lead the business into the data-driven era.
Job Description
As the Data Scientist (Python / AWS), you are responsible for:
Collaborating with cross functional teams to understand business requirements and provide solutions in areas involving Finance / Supply Chain / Customer Service etc.
Driving continuous functionality and feature improvements in data systems.
Developing meaningful dashboards and communicating business insights to the key stakeholders and evangelising a Data Driven Culture within the Organization.
Lead projects such as time-series forecasting and costing optimization and presenting the findings to senior stakeholders.
The Successful Applicant
As a successful applicant, you will have a Degree in Information Technology or equivalent with minimum of 4 years of experience in the Data Analytics domain, backed by strong experience with both unstructured and structured Data. You will have a proven track record of working in Data Analytics projects within Finance / Supply Chain / Customer Service domains, coupled with good knowledge with Machine Learning Techniques such as Time Series Forecasting / Clustering / Decision Tree Learning etc.
You will have a strong experience with visualization tools such as Tableau / PowerBI, backed by relevant working experience with Python and Python Packages such as Pandas, Matplotlib, PySpark etc. You will also have a proven track record of working with AWS Cloud technologies and performing data extraction / data modelling on AWS platform.
What's on Offer
Opportunity to work with Advance Technologies
Leading the Data-Driven Culture
Competitive Salary Package

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The Offer Work alongside & learn from best in class talent Great work environment The Employer Committed to helping clients achieve their business objectives, they are a technology services company that delivers flexible solutions. They have proven that extensive experience, strategic partnerships and management of customer satisfaction results in rapid client acquisition and high client retention. The Job You will be responsible for : Creating predictive and prescriptive models that could have a positive impact on the business. Driving all data analytics activities ranging from conceptualisation, visualisation to operationalisation. Performing statistical analysis on historical data to validate models. Working across stakeholders to identify and capitalise on opportunities to leverage data to drive business solutions. Implementing real-time analytics use-cases on the Hadoop ecosystem. The Profile You possess an advanced degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or related field. You have at least 3 years experience within a Data Scientist role. You have proven Java or Python development skills You have experience with one or more of the following: SAS, SPSS, Python, R, Hadoop or SQL. You have expertise in Data Mining & Knowledge Discovery, Predictive Modelling (Regression, Neural Networks etc) and Data Visualisation Tools (Tableau, Qlikview, Hue etc.). You pay strong attention to detail and deliver work that is of a high standard You possess strong analytical skills and are comfortable dealing with numerical data You are a self-starter and demonstrate a high level of resilience Ref : 07650311

ITE/ NITEC/ Higher NITEC, Diploma, Bachelor's / Honours

Minimum of 3 year(s) experience needed for this position

Title: Azendian - Senior Data Engineer Role (Enable Data Access & U...
Description:
We are looking for dynamic data professionals who will be leading data engineering team, designing and delivering high quality data products - data warehouse, data marts, data lake and data hubs - on cloud or on-premises system environments for the clients in government, public and private sectors.
We invite suitable individuals with strong data management experience to join our information management team. We are rapidly growing and are expanding into numerous domains and industries. If you are looking to expand your capabilities in data and analytics and looking for a team with a vision, come join us!
Senior Data Engineer Responsibilities:
Key responsibilities
Leads, Designs, Builds and supports the data pipeline and all associated Software Engineering infrastructure tasks
Liaising with clients, technical architects, data architects, data scientists and BI Analysts to gather
the requirements
Analysing the data requirements and preparing functional and non-functional specification for
data products.
Designing and Developing data pipeline using either ETL/ELT approach to load or synchronise
data in near real time or batch mode.
Lead ETL Development team and ensure the standards and qualities of ETL development and
deliverables.
Conceptualising and generating the data pipeline that allows big data to be accessed and
analysed.
Preparing Test Plans and conducting Unit Testing, SIT, UAT and Performance Testing
Designing and Implementing deployment approaches and methods to roll-out the system
changes
Remaining up to date with industry standards and technological advancements that will improve
the quality of data products.
He / she must be:
A keen learner with a minimum bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and related fields
A self-starter with an analytical approach to problem solving.
A client-centric, outcome and quality focussed team player.
Competent in written and oral business and technical communication in English.
In term of experience, the successful candidate should have:
At least 3 to 4 years of end-to-end data warehouse, data lake and big data implementation experience
7 or more years’ experience in similar industry area
Mandatory Skills – Informatica ETL Tools , SSIS, SQL Skills, SQL Server , Azure Data Factory, Data
Warehouse, ETL Framework
Value Added Skills - DataStage, Attunity, Hadoop Ecosystem, Data APIs, Unstructured Data and Data
Modelling, BI Tools – Power BI, Microstrategy, Qliksense and Tableau, SAS.
Managed and coached a team to achieve project objectives
Ability to lead teams under pressure with demonstrated experience in project management
Understand solution requirements and design, develop, build and operationalise solutions
Enjoy problem solving in different domains and industries.
Love working with high energy and competent teams

Title: AVP/Senior Associate,DBS Consumer Brand Marketing, Consumer...
Description:
Business Function

As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you.

Responsibilities
The Consumer Brand Team Marketing function will be accountable for achieving business objectives across paid, earned and owned channels through marketing campaigns, events and sponsorships. The team is also accountable for building and shaping brand perception across the various initiatives.
The key responsibilities of the Senior Marketing Manager will be to:
Develop innovative and disruptive marketing and communication strategies and execute plans to succeed in the above objectives.
Delight existing consumers while attracting new prospects through contextual and hyper personalized marketing, new engagement and advocacy campaigns, exploring novel touchpoints and inventive ways of marketing.
Analyze data and create valuable insights to drive digital ATE, build segment knowledge and expertise, and identify opportunities to better connect with our audiences.
The Senior Marketing Manager will work closely with various key stakeholders, including internal and cross-functional teams, as well as external partners such as media and creative agencies; identify and foster key partnerships with relevant brands, advocates and influencers.
The Senior Marketing Manager will define measurement criteria and provide regular updates through reports along with recommendations to refine overall strategy and improve results.
Requirements

At least 6-10 years’ experience in building strategic and creative consumer marketing campaigns, preferably with a background in marketing, communications or worked at a top innovative brand, advertising or media agency.
The ideal candidate should:
Be a marketer and inner data scientist.
Be deeply embedded and relentlessly curious to the digital space from gaming, mobile, social networking, IOT, AI and everything in-between.
Be a fast learner and thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment and demonstrate strong judgment and a solution-driven mindset.
Be a thought-leader with a fascination in brand-building and delivering business results.
Be able to “connect the dots” and see the big picture.
Be a multi-tasker, but with clear time management and prioritization skills. Experience in agile marketing is ideal.
Be open to candid feedback about your performance and seek constructive real-time points as a great way to grow.
Be able to work both independently and in close collaboration with a wide array of stakeholders.
Be a team player and a selfless, collaborative Marketing professional who will naturally go beyond roles and titles to get great work done.
A mastery of verbal and written communication as well as presentation skills, a strong sense of EQ and empathy towards others, and an editorial perspective on building a brand’s social presence with an accessible tone of voice, goes without saying.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Title: Postdoctoral Fellow / Research Fellow: Healthcare Artificial...
Company: NUS Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health
Description:
Postdoctoral Fellow / Research Fellow
For “Healthcare Artificial Intelligence and Data Analytics”
The above positions are now available to support the Principal Investigator, Assistant Professor Feng
Mengling, for his research in the areas of healthcare data analytics and AI solutions.

Dr. Mengling Feng (https://www.mornin-feng.com/) is truly a cross-disciplinary scientists, who is
currently a faculty member of the School of Public Health, School of Computing and School of Medicine,
National University of Singapore (NUS). He is also the Senior Assistant Director working directly with the
Chief Technology Officer (CTO) and Chief Medical Information Officer (CMIO) at National University
Hospital (NUH). Dr. Feng is also an affiliated scientist with MIT. His research is to develop effective data
analysis and machine learning methods to extract actionable knowledge from medical big data to improve
the quality of care. Dr. Feng’s work was recognized by both well-established journals, such as Science
Translational Medicine, and top international conferences, such as KDD, AAAI and AMIA.

Cross-disciplinary and International AI Lab
The selected candidates will be working in a cross-disciplinary team consists of data scientists, physicians,
post-docs, PhD students and well respected faculty members from NUS, NUH and SGH. The candidates
will be working on healthcare projects funded by our Ministry of Health, Health Promotion Board and AI
Singapore. As Dr. Feng is an affiliated scientist, his lab constantly work with faculties and students from the
Harvard-MIT Health Science Technology division. Dr. Feng has over 20 joint publications with Harvard and
MIT between 2017 and 2019. He has also been organizing the annual NUS-MIT Healthcare AI Datathon
(www.nus-datathon.com) , which were covered by many local news channels.

Potential Industrial and Overseas Exposure
Dr. Feng collaborates closely with various local and international industrial partners. Members in Dr. Feng’s
team often have opportunities to work as affiliated scientists in our partnering companies, such as MSD,
PingAn, Google, Intel, Nvidia, IBM, SAP, Philips, local and international start-ups.

Responsibilities and requirements
Major responsibility of the selected candidate is to apply and develop machine learning and AI technologies
to solve healthcare challenges raised by our clinical collaborators. The selected candidate will also be
involved in managing, extracting and pre-processing data for various projects.

Required personal skills:
1. An independent and self-driven worker and a fast learner
2. Well- organized and has an eye for details
3. Excellent written and verbal communication skills
4. Ability to work effectively with colleagues to achieve team goals

Essential technical skills:

1. Excellent academic record
2. Knowledge and experience in statistical analysis or machine learning
3. Programing language: Python or R or C++

Good proficiency and experience in the following areas is a plus:
1. Experience with the PL-SQL/Trans-SQL
2. Knowledge and experience in GPU-based computation
3. Strong in Mathematics
4. Strong foundations in machine learning
5. Candidates with strong publication record in the field of machine learning are preferred

The successful applicants are expected to possess at least the PhD Degree in Computer Science,
Engineering, Mathematics and preferably with relevant experience.

This position will be initially available for one year. The grade of appointment will be accorded based on
candidate’s academic qualifications and years of relevant experience.

Title: #SgUnitedJobs (3-month) Performance Analysis, Singapore Spor...
Description:
At Sport Singapore, we aspire to transform the nation through an active lifestyle designed around innovative, fun and meaningful sporting experiences.
Sport has the unique ability to bring people together through play, regardless of age, gender, race, ability or social status. It imparts life values, nurtures character and builds resilience. It inspires and evokes the Singapore spirit through shared experiences and strengthens our national identity. We help Singaporeans Live Better Through Sport.
Sport Singapore is constantly on the lookout for individuals who are passionate about what they do.
Anchored in our values of Passion for Sport, Strength through Teamwork and Care for People, we believe in working and playing, not just as a team, but as a family.
Responsibilities
You will be part of the team to
Support Sport Scientists/Coaches in designing programmes and intervention to provide objective feedback to athletes on their performance efficiency and effectiveness in training and competitions.
Record, tag, organise, maintain and analyse videos and data collected
Maintain and store equipment inventory.
Requirements
We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service to stakeholders and the community. This individual should be a sport advocate through living an active lifestyle.
In addition, you should possess the following:
Background in Exercise Science, Motor Learning and Performance.
Strong data analytical skills using Tableau, Phython, Smartabase and video analysis software such as SportsCode and Dartfish
Data Analysis or coaching experience is preferred.

We seek your understanding that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Title: Executive, Pricing
Description:
The pricing team is one of the four pillars of the Revenue office in Zalora. We operate at full speed to optimize profit and increase conversion rates by working towards the goal of providing better value pricing for the customers.The Revenue office is a newly formed department within Zalora led by the Chief Revenue Officer and comprises four teams - PMO, Pricing, Merchandising, and Analytics. It considers the product, customer and tech platform as constraints and we use all the levers at our disposal (price, campaign, search, sorting, and processes around them) to get the best possible performance (read Sales and Profit) out of them. The revenue team, albeit an independent function, works closely side by side with buying and marketing.
We are on a lookout for a tech-savvy, curious and ambitious talent who is passionate about creating accurate data solutions to maximize business profits and meet strategic directions of the company. This role will be responsible for supporting the innovation of the Zalora Markdown Model (ZMM), which covers more than half a million prices (SKUs) across 6 countries, a profound impact on the success of the company.
As a pricing analyst dedicated to the algorithmic pricing product, you will generate critical data-driven insights by understanding our customers and acting as a key interface between our Revenue and Data Science teams.You will work closely with the Data Science, Merchandising, and Planning teams. As an empowered team member, frequent interactions with senior leaders (eg. Chief Revenue Officer) is also part of the role.

Responsibilities:
Leverage our data to identify what drives the business impact of the product and where the biggest opportunities are, develop them into the algorithm and reshape the Zalora Markdown Model, signing off on developments and change management, implementing the features to internal stakeholders
Own the A/B-testing pipeline for the model algorithm. Coordinate A/B test setup, monitor ongoing tests and analyze results.
Monitor our product performance by developing reporting solutions and performing ad-hoc analysis. Communicate with departmental and cross-departmental stakeholders.
Help in defining the strategy of the current & new tools to use in the wider Commercial team. Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology.
Represent the Zalora point of view in the parallel creation of a Global Pricing Engine by GFG team
Evaluate existing processes to develop improvements, standardizations, and best practices
Requirements:
1-3 years of analytical experience working for an eCommerce Fashion retailer, technology and an eagerness to develop as an analyst, product manager, or data scientist is desirable
Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills, the ability to turn complex findings and results in a compelling narrative and a set of actions
Led or contributing to a complex technical project related to analytics, testing or data modeling
Familiar with SQL, Tableau, and objection-oriented programming language (Python, R)
Experience in working with Google Analytics, Superset is a plus
Ability to communicate at all levels with an open and honest approach

The ZALORA Story
ZALORA Group is Asia Pacific's leading group of online fashion destinations. Founded in 2012, the company has a presence in Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia and Brunei, the Philippines, Hong Kong and Taiwan. ZALORA is part of Global Fashion Group, the world's leader in online fashion for emerging markets. ZALORA Group's localised sites offer an extensive collection of top international and local brands and products across apparel, shoes, accessories, and beauty categories for men and women. Offering up to 30-day free returns, speedy deliveries as fast as 3 hours in some markets, free delivery over a certain spend, and multiple payment methods including cash-on-delivery, ZALORA Group is the online shopping destination with endless fashion possibilities.
ZALORA is not obligated to accept resumes from any third parties on behalf of potential candidates for any position (advertised or otherwise) by any means, unless ZALORA has executed a written agreement with such third party and has expressly requested such third party for candidate referrals. Third parties who provide unsolicited resumes of candidate(s) shall waive and forfeit all rights to claim for any placement fees or referral fees in the event that such candidate is eventually engaged or employed by Zalora or Global Fashion Group.

Title: Research Scientist (PhotoPhysics)
Description:
My client is a world leader in the photonics and equipment space and now seek an experienced R&D Engineer to study the interaction mechanism between photons and materials and their applications under high power UV light exposure
Responsibilities:
Provide guidance and leadership in surface analytical and data analysis and ensure extraction of clear results and conclusions from data sets.
Strategize and initiate actionable plans by analysing data and discussions with SMEs
Liaise closely with material research scientists, optics engineers and systems engineers to ensure the feasibilities of new material and processes
Understand interaction mechanism between photos and materials and applications to photo contamination, photochemistry under high power UV exposure
Implement controls via materials selection, cleaning processes and purge control.
Establish the reliability model of optics under UV radiation conditions.
Provide guidance to R&D engineers to meet reliability and performance specs of next generation sub-systems
Guide the design teams on proper contamination control packaging/materials selection
Conduct laser damage test and analysis as needed for bulk optics, nonlinear optics, coating improvements and supplier qualification
Requirements:
Masters or Ph.D. in Physics, Optics or equivalent with at least 5 – 10 years’ experience
Strong fundamental knowledge in chemistry, material science and surface science
Solid understanding of interaction mechanism between photos and materials
Knowledge of GCMS and other surface analytical techniques (SEM, TOF-SIMS, ICP-MS, AFM) a plus
Experience in setting up optical bench for conducting opto-electronic measurements
Prior knowledge in optics damage testing and optical coatings will be a plus
Ability to make project decisions based on based on optical fluence models to set purge gas requirements and select optics, opto-mechanics.
Please send your resume in WORD format by clicking the apply button below or contact Abhik Damani on +65 6701 1527 for a confidential discussion. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted. CEI Reg. Number R1544061 (Abhik Damani).

Title: Software Architect
Description:
As Autodesk transitions to the cloud, our value comes from building and scaling reliable and trusted cloud services. The Forge platform unlocks the functionality in Autodesk products that have been serving industries such as manufacturing and construction. You will join Autodesk Forge in Singapore, driving the strategy of Forge and influencing the direction of cloud services and technology.

Responsibilities
Strategic Guidance:
Define and drive the Forge data work in a strategic direction from a technical perspective
Be the “visionary”, providing the team with a grasp of its future capabilities and technical potential
Comprehensive responsibility for the Forge data’s architecture to include ongoing reengineering and modification of the existing architecture and for creating and developing architectural advances to accommodate future features and capabilities while maintaining architectural adaptability
Evaluate the feasibility of alternative directions in future architecture/platform development through the creation of models and prototypes
Conduct effective code and architecture reviews, ensuring security, scalability and resilience, from the end system, product, service or module
Provide strategic and tactical direction. Create technology roadmaps, making assertions about technology directions and determining their consequences for the technical strategy and hence architectural approach
Work with tech leads to influence and communicate technical direction
Guide teams in identifying performance issues, consulting with technology leads regarding work priorities and systems performance cost – benefit analysis
Propose the creation and development of advanced foundational architecture that will enable future feature expansion
Explore the feasibility of technology modifications through new releases in response to identified user needs/interests/priorities and/or competitor capabilities
Provide consulting support in the identification and development of competitive product strategies to maintain and enhance product differentiation in the marketplace
Align the technical direction with business needs, leading the team to make the correct compromises between short-term business opportunity and long-term technical vision
Coordinate with experience design and product management on these compromises to ensure successful execution to achieve long term business and technology goals
Technological Guidance:
Provide technical leadership for the group, Autodesk and within the Industry. Act as a leader to the development community, evangelizing, communicating, and distributing technical information
Build relationships with other groups to ensure common strategy for the company and coordination of efforts
Evaluate soundness of potential technology acquisitions and provides formal analysis of recommendations regarding capabilities, utility within the scope of the Company’s existing technologies, integration issues and technology-based benefits. Investigate new technologies and develop feasibility projections regarding their potential impact upon the future technology marketplace
Prepare and present to Autodesk management and at conferences, both internal and external.
Provide training to internal and external audiences
Write and review white papers on technical aspects, future and/or architecture of products
Support infrastructure and operations of services balancing the importance of security, deployment and management of services


Minimum Qualifications
Experience programming in Java, .Net, Go and/or Python
Experience with computer architecture, distributed systems, and networking
Experience developing large-scale cloud application architectures to meet business requirements in complex environments
Experience with software development lifecycle (SDLC) processes, tools, and Agile methodologies
Excellent communication, collaboration skills, and be able to lead by influencing leaders and peers


Preferred Qualifications
Graduate or Postgraduate in Computer Science Engineering or related technical fields, or equivalent practical experience
10+ years of software design, development, and consulting experience in cloud systems or web services
4+ years of hands-on experience in solving complex engineering problems as a Software/Cloud Architect or Technical Lead


The Ideal Candidate
Team player who can work closely with stakeholders to ensure the successful delivery of projects. Teamwork is critical to our success
Deliver technical solutions that address new levels of complexity, scale, and performance, enabling breakthrough innovations for Autodesk customers
Apply and create best practices in multiple technical domains using cloud technology products
Partner with senior stakeholders regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management, and risk mitigation
Regularly coach and mentor others on best practices
Excellent written and presentation skills, specifically the ability to translate business requirements from various business units into project proposals with a clear and well-designed architecture
Ability to clearly express complex technical concepts in ways that audience from diverse disciplines are able to understand

About Autodesk
With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It's disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital scientists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider employment for all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.
To all recruitment agencies: Autodesk does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Autodesk will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Autodesk, Inc.

Title: Sr. Technical Application Scientist
Company: Cargill Asia Pacific Holdings Pte Ltd
Description:
Job Description :
The Senior Technical Application Scientist provides technical advice and support to customers during and after the sale of products. This position analyzes and converts customer insights into projects which tackle current challenges and deliver new solutions. The Senior Technical Application Scientist introduces new technology concepts and recommendations into project/product design. At this level, you will perform under minimal supervision and the role is expected to independently solve complex issues while referring only the most complex problems to a higher-level staff.

Key Accountabilities
Solves complex product-related questions and provides technical support via email, phone, or in person.

Handles product issues and reports data to product development teams. Reviews scientific reports and datasheets detailing the organization's products and their applications.

Performs complex research for product development to understand product properties and system operations.

Compiles and analyzes data for project updates and works with external suppliers to test new products and technologies and make recommendations on applications.

Identifies and explores trends in the food services space and converts knowledge to product opportunities.

Organizes project data and conclusions for internal and customer presentations. Assists with product demonstrations and serves as the subject matter guide during meetings with prospective customers.

Provides leadership, coaching, mentoring and/or supervision to a subordinate group.

Performs other duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelorâ€™s Degree in a related field or equivalent experience

Minimum 4 years of directly related work experience

Possesses comprehensive technical knowledge

Shift requirements, such as: "May require working in (second, third, rotating) shifts."(Remove this section if the position occurs during normal business hours.)

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in a technical related field such as food safety, quality assurance, or product management

Excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills

Ability to effectively deliver technical information to non-technical audience

Effective social and team working skills

Ability to organize multiple priorities on dynamic schedule, prioritization skills

Field service and technical service experience

Ambitious, skilled in work planning and execution, seeking out for self-development and improvement

Title: Material Research and Product development assistant #SGUnite...
Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Traineeship description: KrossLinker is a Singapore based advanced nanomaterial start-up founded by a team of passionate material and chemical engineering scientists. Krosslinker is funded by top global investors including VC firms in Asia and Entrepreneur First
This position reports to the Lead Materials Scientist and Chief Technology Officer. The trainee will be trained in conducting material science related research and product development work for challenging thermal insulation applications.

Specific responsibilities:
1. Day to day laboratory activities, experiments, analysis and data logging.
2. Product development for new markets through advance chemistry techniques and methodology.
3. Research progress reviews and presentation to senior management.
4. Implementation of SOPs, safe work procedures and processes.

Competencies:
1. Communication and Problem-Solving Skills.
2. Laboratory Operations Management
3. Laboratory Data Reporting and Analysis
4. Laboratory Equipment Maintenance and calibration management
5. Product Testing and Quality Management
6. Technical Report Writing
7. Third Party Management including contractors, vendors and suppliers
8. Technical Presentation

This position guarantees an exciting steep learning curve in a dynamic startup environment, opportunity to work closely and learn directly from passionate scientist founders and see the trainee's work translate into real, concerted impact on the company.

Title: Data Science Researcher (Python / Spark / Hadoop)
Description:
Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
Highly Collaborative Environment
About Our Client
Our client is an Artificial Intelligence Platform and they are looking for a highly analytical Data Science Researcher (Python / Spark / Hadoop) to explore huge datasets from various environments and apply state of the art AI/ML techniques to solve real world business problems.
Job Description
As the Data Science Researcher (Python / Spark / Hadoop), you are responsible for:
Engaging with clients and identifying key problem statements in the areas of risk, fraud or natural language processing (NLP).
Researching and experimenting with state-of-the-art machine learning (ML) / AI algorithms to solve said key problem statements.
Driving continuous functionality and feature improvements of the AI products.
Collaborating with other research scientists and engineers to formulate innovative solutions to implement advanced AI techniques and taking them to production.
The Successful Applicant
As a successful applicant, you will have a PhD in Computer Science or equivalent with minimum of 2 years of experience in the Data Science domain, backed by a good track record of working on Anomaly Detection and Clustering use cases. You will also be an expert with Python as a programming language, backed by a strong understanding of Big Data infrastructure technologies such as Spark / Hadoop etc.
You will have a strong background in Natural Language Processing (NLP), coupled with relevant working experience in Graph databases and Graph algorithms.
What's on Offer
Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
Highly Collaborative Environment
Attractive Salary Package

Title: Senior Back-End Engineer
Description:
We’re BCG Digital Ventures. Are you open to the adventure of a lifetime?
Our mission is to invent, launch, scale and invest in game-changing businesses with the world’s most influential corporations. We launch a new business every month and we have the backing of one of the world’s leading consultancy firms: the Boston Consulting Group. We combine BCG’s resources and domain expertise with our diverse, global team of accomplished designers, engineers, product experts and business strategists to launch ventures in many different industries, incorporating groundbreaking technologies such as blockchain or machine learning. All of us are entrepreneurs at heart, seeking to move quickly and nimbly in order to find new ways of delivering value to our customers.
Engineering at BCGDV
Our multidisciplinary engineering team tackles challenges at their core. From product and test engineers to full stack engineers and data scientists, our venture builders all share a passion for innovative and emerging digital solutions. Working in collaboration with product and design teams, they use cutting-edge and custom technologies to imagine, build and launch breakthrough digital businesses that disrupt markets and generate untold value for businesses and consumers alike.
About The Role
As a back end engineer you will be a valued member of a multi-skilled venture team, building disruptive and innovative products and businesses. We operate in a truly agile fashion, so you will get to deliver working software to customers daily and learn from the results. You will bring your experience and skill to bear on the multitude of new and exciting challenges that appear when trying to bring a new product or business to market. Is this an exciting adventure that you’d like to be part of?
What You’ll Do
Grow innovative, groundbreaking products and business that address real customer frictions
Learn how to found, grow and operate successful startups
Design and architect innovative, modern architectures
Lead the technical development for large areas of a product
Support and mentor junior engineers
Write code as part of a diverse and multi-skilled development team
Champion a focus on software qualities such as testability, security, scalability, operability etc
Work with state of the art technologies to solve genuine, real-world problems
Champion good agile practices that provide a foundation for iterative product development
Build strong relationships with product managers, venture architects and designers
Enjoy working in a diverse, dynamic, collaborative, transparent, environment where everyone's ideas and opinions are equally valued
Contribute to the growth of the DV Singapore Engineering cohort
Demonstrate and communicate a passion for implementing highly scalable and maintainable backend services
Share technical solutions and product ideas through design review, pair programming, code review and technological discussions
What You’ll Bring
Hands-on development and delivery experience with a broad mix of languages and technologies
Real passion for solving customer frictions through simple and effective software
Strong people skills that contribute to an open and collaborative environment
Experience working with Agile, Lean and Continuous Delivery approaches, such as Continuous Integration, TDD, Infrastructure as Code etc.
Experience in communicating ideas and decisions to a variety of team members
Experience building cloud native software architectures
An ability to embrace and reduce uncertainty through continual validated learning
Building great software at web scale requires a multidisciplinary approach to engineering. It is far more important to be able to reason intelligently about complex problems, and apply experience to new domains than it is to know specifics about the newest technology buzzword
Below are the technologies we primarily use for back end development. However, we'll always choose the best tool for the job (maybe you can suggest one?), so don't consider this list either exhaustive or immutable:
Languages / Frameworks
Ruby/Rails, Go, Python, JavaScript
Infrastructure
Docker, Kubernetes, Amazon Web Services, AWS Lambda
About BCGDV
BCG Digital Ventures is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law.

Excellent oral, written, and presentation communication skills

Title: Big Data Lead
Description:
Job Responsibilities
Razer is looking for a Big Data Lead who will lead a team of Data Engineer and Data Scientist. This team is responsible for the architecture, design, and development of a robust data pipeline infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, loading of data from different sources for our software platform. It also builds models to analyze data for trends and patterns beneficial to growing the company’s business.

Data curation, including extraction, transform and loading from multiple data sources.
Undertake data exploration, building of models to address business problems.
Devise and utilize algorithms to mine big data stores, perform data and error analysis to improve models, and clean and validate data for uniformity and accuracy.
Analyze data for trends and patterns.
Communicate information to stakeholders using data visualization techniques.
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges.
Collaborate with engineering and product development.
Work with external partners and experts from time to time on special projects.
Pre-Requisites
Degree in Data Engineering, Data Science or related field of study.
5 years in managing a data pipeline, and mining and analyzing data.
At least 2 years leading a team
Experience in developing and deploying applications running on public cloud platforms such as AWS and Google Cloud Platform.
Experience in applying and showing an understanding of machine learning algorithms used for classification, regression, clustering, recommendation system, etc.

Title: Windows Developer - Experience innovation group
Description:
We are looking for native Windows Developers with 7+ years’ experience. As part of the Experience Innovation Group (EIG) in the CTO office, the Software POC team needs people that can imagine new products, solutions and technologies – then quickly build them into tangible prototypes that can be tested.
At EIG we are a diverse range of people who have worked in industrial design, UX development, consulting, film, data science and more, all working together to create amazing solutions that have real impact at scale for customers. We’re a multi-functional, agile team with all the skills and capabilities to interact with customers, research and gather insights, explore future technologies, and develop them into products.
Our new Singapore innovation centre is a key part of Dell’s vision – come join us and you’ll get to use your skills to explore, research and build ground-breaking products and experiences where your ideas will make a real impact on our customers. We are a global team with a global remit who work across the full range of Dell products and brands like Alienware, XPS and Precision – exploring topics from the future of collaboration to the future of gaming & esports.
To give you a taste of the kind of things we get to think about, then here are some of the concept ideas Dell presented at CES this year: https://www.zdnet.com/article/ces-2020-dells-future-folding-dual-screen-and-handheld-gaming-devices/
Find out more about the work EIG does here:
http://www.dellexperienceinnovation.com/
If you’d like to join a group that’s focused on exploring augmented reality, human-centered design and the future of computing then you are the right place.
We are Experiences First.

Key Responsibilities

Participate in early stage product design process and research, working with a wide variety of people to frame a set of solutions around the future of computing. Then identify opportunities to test these concepts with prototypes, and rapidly build them first for the purposes of testing & validation, then as a full specification for engineering.
You should have the bravery to challenge the status quo and think different; thrive in ambiguity; work out loud together; thrive in a culture of giving ‘tough’ love to care for each other and the ideas; be ever curious, always connecting the dots.

You will:
Be a person who thinks of new ideas and fresh ways to try things, with a sound technical grounding.
Work with the wider team to scope & build POC’s for testing and further development, working closely with Frontend devs, Cloud architects, Mobile and Unity developers.
Be comfortable with stepping outside your domain area and learn other types of development, particularly around AR systems.
Be an exemplar leader in bringing industry standard best practices & processes to projects.
Essential Requirements
Strong experience in building high quality desktop applications with C++
7+ years’ experience in Native Windows Development
BS/MS in CS or other relevant educational background
Track record of team leadership and initiative
Demonstrated ability to lead computer architecture and software development lifecycles using Agile, Git and CI/CD systems
Comfortable developing in a Linux environment
Solid understanding of IP networking and implementation
Very solid understanding of object-oriented design principles, architecture and patterns
C/C++/C# for desktop development
Familiarity with native Windows APIs (eg Win32, .Net, UWP)
Comfortable developing in a Linux environment
Excellent communicator and able to thrive in a fluid, flexible and at times ambiguous innovation environment
Desirable Requirements
IoT & alternative form factors, Unity, AR/VR, development experience; Mad Scientists are most welcome.
Familiarity with the Windows Driver Kit (WDK)
Experience with cloud services such as AWS/Azure
Dell Technologies is a unique family of businesses that helps organizations and individuals build their digital future and transform how they work, live and play—providing customers with the industry’s broadest and most innovative technology and services portfolio. We value our customers, winning together, innovation, results and integrity. Grow your career with a highly competitive salary, bonus programs, world-class benefits and unparalleled learning and development opportunities— all at a company that is proud to be diverse and inclusive. Learn more on how we are closing the diversity gap here.

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Employment Opportunity Policy here.

Title: Software Engineer, Backend Development (Knowledge Team)
Description:
Appier is a technology company which aims to provide artificial intelligence platforms to help enterprises solve their most challenging business problems. Appier was established in 2012 by a passionate team of computer scientists and engineers with expertise in AI, data analysis, distributed systems, and marketing.
About the role
Software Engineer, Backend Development at Appier focus on designing the most flexible, scalable backend architecture with optimized performance to pave the engineering road of our new products.

Task of the role
Develop and operate data warehouse system and ETL pipeline for data access, collection, processing and storage, and support data analysis tasks.
Dedicate to Big Data and Machine Learning Platform using Apache Spark and related technologies.
Responsible for laying the foundation for the platform as well as proposing solutions to ease software development, monitoring of software, etc.
Ensures the scalability and availability of the system.
Handling hundred of terabyte data.
Profiling and performance tuning of critical components.
Participate in idea brainstorming and contribute ideas to technology, algorithms and products.


About you
[Essential]
BS/BA degree in Computer Science or related field.
3+ years experience building and operating large scale distributed systems or applications.
Good at Python and Spark development.
Expertise in developing data structures, algorithms on top of Big Data platforms.
Experience with managing data storage using Cassandra / MongoDB / Redis.
Familiar with git.
Team player and able to work independently.
Proactive, good interpersonal and problem-solving skill.
Eagerness to change the world in a huge way by being a self-motivated learner and builder.

[Nice to have]
5+ years of experience in Internet Industry.
Contributing to open source projects is a huge plus (Please include your Github page).
Experience with Kubernetes / Terraform / Ansible.
Familiar with Golang
Familiar with Airflow.
Familiar with Amazon Web Service.
Experience with Hadoop, Hive, Flink, Storm, Presto and related big data systems.

Why join us?
We believe in building a great working environment where passionate individual can give their best, and to work with a talented team. To reward Appiers for their contribution, we also work hard to offer perks and benefits to make their life better
Perks and benefits
Company office locations at the heart of central business district (CBD) in all our countries.
Well stocked pantry with snacks and drinks
Competitive salary
Equity in one of the most exciting Artificial Intelligence startup in Asia
Health insurance for all employees
Your choice between Mac and Microsoft OS
Frequent company and team gatherings to celebrate success and life in general

Title: Principal Innovation Scientist
Description:
Site Name: Singapore - Rochester Park
Posted Date: May 26 2020
The R&D Innovation Research Principal Scientist will,
Be responsible for leading and driving early stage innovation projects for local star and drive for profit brands for wider APAC
Ensures that the voice of the consumer is heard and that consumer input drives the initiatives pursued
Ensures identification of new opportunities in line with innovation strategy and design technical strategy that is viable to lead to a successful launch
Lead the connection with all R&D, Commercial, and Supply Chain functions to enable the building of a robust project for delivery into the pipeline
Work directly with external scouting team to identify and evaluate new viable innovation opportunities
Writes technical papers, presents in external forums to enhance personal, departmental and corporate reputation.
This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career, these responsibilities include some of the following,
Execution Powerhouse
Deliver qualified (consumer and technical) early stage projects and successfully transitions them into the development pipeline
Identify, assess and drive forward key innovation opportunities
Provide technical support and project leadership for identified innovation opportunities for the category.
Growth Mindset
Lead cross-functional sharing of scientific or consumer opportunities, breaking down any ‘silos’
Drive and maintain awareness of scientific literature and competitive intelligence to assist work progression and understanding
Establish supportive, developmental and learning-orientated environment.
Consumer and Customer-Obsessed
Serve as the voice of the consumer when developing early stage opportunities through close interaction with consumer insights and product understanding, driving early consumer input / technical consumer understanding into innovation ideas.
Create technical and product understanding research plans to fit overall project objectives
Data-Driven
Perform comprehensive, sophisticated and critical evaluation of internal and external data
Author technical papers/presentations to enhance personal, departmental and corporate reputation.
Lead Due Diligence on external innovation opportunities to deliver strong technical recommendations
Agile
Deliver innovative and better ways of doing things; actively look to eliminate non-value-added steps out of processes and procedures
Mentor and advise colleagues when unexpected results occur or when major changes to project plans are considered
Why you?
Basic Qualifications:
We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
Bachelors Degree in Chemical, Pharmaceutical, Engineering or related science
At least 6 years of experience in a scientific role
A strong technical understanding on the requirements to deliver innovation (across medicines, consumer goods, and devices) to the marketplace is necessary along with a good grasp of the challenges associated with the other core areas in order for the incumbent to deal with the technical complexity inherent in the role and to understand the regulatory, quality and safety implications of any decisions made.
Experience in consumer-focused global healthcare related products / brand management
Experience of working in highly complex matrix organization
Why GSK?
GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) is a science-led global healthcare company with a special purpose: to help people do more, feel better, live longer. We have three global businesses that research, develop and manufacture innovative pharmaceutical medicines, vaccines and consumer healthcare products. Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies.
We are proud of the difference we make. GSK has ranked 1st in the Access to Medicines Index all five times since its launch in 2008 and FORTUNE Magazine ranked us #1 on its ‘Change the World list’ which recognises companies that have made significant progress in sustainable, scalable approaches to addressing societal problems as part of their company strategy.
GSK has been present in Asia for over 50 years and our commitment to the region is strengthened by the establishment of our purpose-built headquarters for Asia. Situated in Singapore, GSK Asia House is a further step in our long-standing strategy to grow and diversify our company - emphasizing the globally balanced business we have built over the years. To better support Asia, we focus on developing talent to improve our ability to make the right decisions for healthcare professionals, patients and consumers across the region.
GSK’s dedication to the wellbeing of our employees is reflected in the benefits we offer; including healthcare for yourself and dependents, performance related bonus, long term incentives and a host of other flexible offerings you can tailor to your own preferences. We also offer a range of employee health and wellbeing programs including our truly unique Partnership for Prevention program, a global commitment by GSK to provide all employees with up to 40 preventative healthcare services bringing to life our mission to: do more, feel better and live longer.
At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged, supportive of one another, and know their work makes an important contribution.
LI-GSK
Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies
GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Data Warehouse Architect (Big Data)
Singapore

Title: Data Science Researcher (Python / Spark / Hadoop)
Description:
Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
Highly Collaborative Environment
About Our Client
Our client is an Artificial Intelligence Platform and they are looking for a highly analytical Data Science Researcher (Python / Spark / Hadoop) to explore huge datasets from various environments and apply state of the art AI/ML techniques to solve real world business problems.
Job Description
As the Data Science Researcher (Python / Spark / Hadoop), you are responsible for:
Engaging with clients and identifying key problem statements in the areas of risk, fraud or natural language processing (NLP).
Researching and experimenting with state-of-the-art machine learning (ML) / AI algorithms to solve said key problem statements.
Driving continuous functionality and feature improvements of the AI products.
Collaborating with other research scientists and engineers to formulate innovative solutions to implement advanced AI techniques and taking them to production.
The Successful Applicant
As a successful applicant, you will have a PhD in Computer Science or equivalent with minimum of 2 years of experience in the Data Science domain, backed by a good track record of working on Anomaly Detection and Clustering use cases. You will also be an expert with Python as a programming language, backed by a strong understanding of Big Data infrastructure technologies such as Spark / Hadoop etc.
You will have a strong background in Natural Language Processing (NLP), coupled with relevant working experience in Graph databases and Graph algorithms.
What's on Offer
Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
Highly Collaborative Environment
Attractive Salary Package
