Title: Staff Optical Process Automation Engineer - Silicon Photonic...
Description:
Detailed information about the Job:
Inside this Business Group
The Data Platofrm Group (DPG) is at the heart of Intelâ€™s transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, high speed optical connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and delivers the products and technologiesâ€”spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutionsâ€”that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

The Role:
Define, justify, implement, and validate manufacturing equipment for assembly processes for optical sub-components, components and modules. Specifically high accuracy optical alignment and bonding of optical components with Single Mode Fiber.

Work with a team of engineers and scientists to develop and bring to manufacturing new equipment and assembly processes required for new products
Define equipment requirements and write detailed procurement specifications
Provide leadership to Engineering and Operations teams on area of expertise
Use sound engineering practice and modeling techniques to design equipment fixtures and process
Prepare proposals for capital expenditure
Manage equipment installation and start-up
Provide technical support and expertise during design, install, start-up, and preliminary production runs of new processes
Provide technical training and expertise to operators during process implementation
Provide leadership in defining continuous improvement programs for equipment and processes

Responsibilities and Qualification may include:
Extensive industry experience in high volume Single Mode Fiber optical coupling.
Highly skilled in using DFM (design for manufacturability), DOE (design of experiment), FMEA (failure modes & effect analysis), gauge R&R, and problem solving skills
High familiarity with use of Statistical Tools and Software such as JMP
Must have directly experience working in a manufacturing environment
Demonstrated record of yield and cycle time improvement
Knowledge of six-sigma, SPC and process capability, OCAP (Out of Control Action Plan), written procedure, operator training, Kaizen or continuous improvement, lean manufacturing techniques
Previous experiences preferably in optical components, modules or solar industries
Demonstrated ability to work with and drive cross-functional groups and external partners
Strong track-record of developing and implementing innovative solutions to complex problems in a timely manner
Demonstrated use of project management skills
Knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices and procedures in a manufacturing environment
Excellent verbal and written communication and interrelationship skills.
Other Information: Moving Data With Light Be part of our revolution in high-speed optical connectivity products.

Define, justify, implement, and validate manufacturing equipment for assembly processes for optical sub-components, components and modules. Specifically high accuracy optical alignment and bonding of optical components with Single Mode Fiber.

Title: Mechatronics R&D Engineer
Description:
Responsible for the complete design process, including:
Driving requirements specification
Feasibility studies
Hold design reviews throughout design process, including hardware and software
Procurement of prototype parts
Prototype assembly integration and testing
Create assembly and operation procedures. Documentation release.
Work closely with other research groups in both US and SG, to ensure the mechatronic instruments designed meet the expected features and performances requirements.
Work closely with research scientists on mechatronic systems troubleshooting and upgrading as needed to meet with latest requirement
Show a great deal of creativity in hands-on implementation of mechatronic hardware/software solutions for a variety of projects

Requirements:
Minimum Master degree qualified in robotics engineering, electrical engineering or related with at least 3 years of experience
Strong LabVIEW knowledge/experience required; Certified LabVIEW Associate Developer (CLAD) preferred. Able to maintain/debug existing and write new programs in LabVIEW to operate test fixtures and apparatuses.
Design experience of custom mechatronics systems, including translating stages, linear motors, temperature and power sensors, data acquisition, etc.
Mechanical design skill is desirable with solid CAD, ProEngineer/Creo/Solidworks
Must be a team player with good written and verbal communication skills

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: Research Fellow
Description:
Wilmar International, a major food production company, and the ECE Department of NUS are jointly building new research programs that investigate biosensor chips for food technology. The aim is to develop wireless biosensing system to monitor in-package food quality and composition.

Successful applicants will become full-time employee of Wilmar International and he/she is expected to work in NUS as well as Wilmar laboratories. The position involves the investigation of wirelessly-coupled electro-impedance sensors and their integration into a range of food packages. The work involves collaboration with biochemists, food scientists, and data scientists to develop the chemical functionalization, analysis, and integration of the system.

We look for someone who is motivated to design, fabricate, and characterize sensor at both the material and electronic sensor level, to work in a multidisciplinary team. A range of research experiences are welcomed. These includes microelectronic fabrication, wireless sensor electrical testing and characterization. Familiarity or background with biochemistry, electro-impedance, voltammetry sensing, are pluses.

Responsibilities may include: -
Fabrication and miniaturization of sensor in a microelectronic clean room, and 3D/2D printing technologies.
Electrical set up and testing for wireless sensor system.
Work in a bio-safe/food-safe environment to implement and test the sensor technologies.
Interface with electrical engineers, data scientist, food technologist to implement a complete system.
Conduct independent research to analyse and interpret, electrical and chemical data, followed by initiation of new experiments and inventions base on the findings.
Organize experiment plans and results for communication to team mates and Wilmar/NUS supervisors.

Qualifications
Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering, Material Science, Bio/Bio-medical/Chemical Engineering, or related fields from a reputable University/Institute.
Fluent in English with good communication skills relevant to writing and presenting.
Open to fixed-term contract.

Candidates are subjected to selection processes by Wilmar International and NUS, successful candidates will be offered an employment contract with Wilmar International and he/she will be expected to work at NUS as well as Wilmar International laboratories. The terms of employment contract is defined by Wilmar International.

Interested applicants should send their motivation letter, curriculum vitae, and publication list via email to Prof. Aaron Thean (Aaron.Thean@nus.edu.sg) or Dr. Untzizu Elejalde (untzizu.elejalde@sg.wilmar-intl.com).

Title: Research Associate, Ocular Imaging Research Group
Description:
The Singapore Eye Research Institute (SERI) serves as Singapore’s national research institute for ophthalmic and vision research. SERI functions as the research arm of the various clinical ophthalmic centres in Singapore, including the Singapore National Eye Centre (SNEC), the national clinical centre for ophthalmology in Singapore. SERI has developed a world-leading reputation in broad-based clinical translational research programmes for eye diseases.
SERI is seeking a highly qualified individual to take on a significant role in a rapidly expanding ocular imaging program. The position offers the opportunity to do excellent research work at SERI.
He/ She will assist the Investigators and Consultants in the successful execution of the project(s). He/ She will be expected to:
Perform novel image analysis on ocular imaging data
Compile data, summarize and interpret results of the analysis in reports and journal articles
Collaborate with other imaging- and data-scientists to derive and validate novel image-based algorithms in support of eye disease detection and patient risk stratification
Participate (where necessary) in other working groups within SERI and NTU

6482BR
Job Requirements
Bachelor of Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related discipline
Possess good programming and image processing skills (e.g. MATLAB, Python)
Previous experience in medical image analysis and software development
Able to work independently, as well as in a team-based, cross-functional research team

Research

Research & Development

Singapore

Title: Account Based Marketing Manager, ASEAN
Description:
Are you excited by the “ABM” buzz? Do you want to be part of a companywide shift to accelerate growth through improved marketing and sales collaboration? Do you have a desire to use your B2B marketing experience to drive revenue growth?

Autodesk is currently hiring Account Based Marketing Managers who are responsible for leading the development, implementation, execution and measurement of targeted account-focused programs in collaboration with account-based sales teams.

Responsibilities
Campaign Planning and Execution
Drive account-specific marketing planning aligned to sales strategies for account-appropriate offerings
Focus on the buyer’s journey and deploy the right programmatic and account-specific tactical mix to deliver the right content at the right time
Create annual and quarterly marketing plans for targeted list of accounts and contacts that focus on customer acquisition and accelerate existing opportunity close and expansion
Evaluate, select and manage vendors that contribute to local demand creation programs including agencies, direct mail providers, and fulfillment services

Collaboration and Interface
Primary liaison with sales representatives and account teams for targeted accounts list
Proactively engage with the direct and indirect sales teams to coordinate, communicate, and optimize the impact of marketing activities
Collaborate with Industry Marketing, Territory Marketing, and Marketing Systems and Services partners to ensure programmatic execution of personalized campaigns to targeted accounts, and 1:1 or 1:few account-based marketing tactics to select focus accounts

Reporting and Analysis
Maintain accurate and actionable understanding of contact data quality for targeted accounts list
Review and provide analysis of programmatic account-based campaigns and unique account-specific tactics for targeted accounts list
Ensure that each marketing activity is tracked and measured
Use data and dashboards to inform future tactics and programmatic campaign adjustments

Budget and Revenue Accountability
Work with Territory Marketing and Industry Marketing to provide requirements for deployment of budget managed by those groups in support of targeted list of accounts
Manage budget and vendor relationships for account-specific tactics for targeted list of accounts
Monitor the delivery and execution of plans, and measure effectiveness of resource allocation, efficiency and ROI to inform any adjustments

Minimum Requirements
At least 5 years of B2B demand generation/field marketing experience with proven account-based marketing specific knowledge and skills
BA/BS or equivalent work experience
Knowledge and experience with sales and marketing automation tools such as Salesforce.com, Marketo, Engagio, etc
Estimated 20% travel required

About Autodesk
With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It's disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital scientists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.
At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider employment for all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.
To all recruitment agencies: Autodesk does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Autodesk will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Autodesk, Inc.

Title: Director of Engineering
Description:
A pioneering artificial intelligence engineering company that creates advanced software solutions that go beyond conventional AI has made available a Director of Engineering job. This is a job opportunity for someone who has a strong understanding of cognitive AI, best-in-class Machine Learning and AI technologies and a background in productisation.
About the Director of Engineering Role:
In 2020, the business is dramatically expanding their presence in the Asia Pacific region leveraging the dynamic hub of Singapore as the regional headquarters with offices in Taiwan and Hong Kong. The Director of Engineering for Singapore will be a critical driver of this growth.
They are seeking an outstanding technology and business leader who will lead the development of cognitive AI solutions to serve customers in the region. This leadership role will work in close collaboration with the Managing Director, Singapore and CTO, APAC to define and implement technology and product road maps.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead and implement the technology and product road-map for the company
Accelerate “Time to Market” for new product creation
Own and drive the product co-innovation strategy with external strategic partners in research, engineering and product development including government research agencies and system integrators
Work with product and engineering team members and other stakeholders to develop architecture road-maps
Serve as the subject matter expert for technical and solution architecture that will include configuration, development, integration and customisation of complex environments
Keep abreast of new trends and best practices in the technology landscape and advise on technology disruptions and opportunities
Make technology choices with respect to product and platform road map decisions
Provide thought leadership, innovation and creativity in the company and across the technical community externally
To succeed in this Director of Engineering role, you will need to position yourself as the technical thought leader in the AI industry. You must be passionate about the start-up ecosystem and cutting edge AI, to build and lead a team of solution architects, technical project managers, data scientists and software engineers to work on challenging customer projects in a variety of industries.
Key Requirements:
PhD or Master’s in Engineering
At least 12 years' software design and development experience with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design
At least five years in AI, data science, ML or related industries
Experience in, but not limited to, machine learning algorithms such as CNN, RNN, reinforcement learning, support vector machines and graph-based models
Leadership experience in building and launching SaaS products to market
Proven experience in building and leading technical teams
Excellent communication skills at all levels of the organisation
A deep understanding across all layers of tech stack from UI, through to RESTful services, containers, VMs, networks and so on
Strong experience with two of the following programming languages: Python, Go, Scala and Java
Beyond Limits is a pioneering Artificial Intelligence company with a technology legacy in Space Exploration. A spin-off of NASA's Jet Propulsion Lab and Caltech, Beyond Limits provides advanced intelligence solutions that go far beyond conventional AI. Our cognitive computing technology mimics human thought processes and provides autonomous reasoning to aid human-like decision-making.

Beyond Limits provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Beyond Limits complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
If you are keen to join one of the most exciting AI companies to advocate the company story and its technology, this Director of Engineering could be the right role for you.
Apply today to learn more.

Title: Head of Intelligence and Personalized Journey's
Description:
The APAC & EMEA Citi Consumer business is aggressively executing its digital strategy across the 17 markets in which it operates. A key enabler to Citi's digital strategy is its desire to leverage its vast data assets and combine this with Machine Learning, AI, and its advanced analytical technology stack to automate and scale 1-to-1 personalized content and messages to each of its clients.
The Head of Intelligence and Personalized Journey’s is a senior leadership role within the regional office. It will play a critical role in Citi's digital and data strategy by developing a data and AI lead decision engine that will determine what, how, and when to communicate with each customer.
The candidate will develop this vision, determine the milestones, identify and secure resourcing, obtain buy-in from C-level executives, and lead a team of Data Scientists and Data Product Owners to execute against this vision.
The role will work closely with Region & Country Senior Business and Product Managers, the Analytics and Information Management (AIM) Centre of Excellence, Technology, and Decision Management.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop Citi's data and AI-led personalization vision and strategy for the APAC and EMEA region
Regularly communicate this vision to all employees and the progress we are making against this vision
Working closely with business analytics teams, identify and prioritize critical data lead journeys/applications that will have a material impact on client experience and business P&L and will enable the broader personalization vision
Working with different groups (business, technology, data scientists, etc.) lead the ideation and grooming of the end to end data product/journey (MVP 1, MVP 2, etc.) and ensure close alignment with the overall personalization vision
Working closely with technology, align end-state architecture, data and tools with the personalization vision
Oversee, govern and execute the delivery of the personalization vision
Ensure personalization capabilities are horizontally designed and scalable across the markets and aligned to the end state personalization vision
Ensure all personalization capabilities include the necessary controls & monitoring required for a highly automated and scalable solution
Measure and communicate to C-level executives the impact the personalization vision and implementation of this vision is having on business value and client experience KPI's
Broader Marketing to all employees on the progress of the personalization vision - business-wide communication of what solutions are available, their impact and what is coming in the future
Obtain any funding required to deliver and maintain the data product (resources, licenses, technology, etc.)
A clear strategy and plan for each data product/journey. Able to describe how we are building agile and how we will iterate to improve.
Incorporate experimentation principals into the design and measurement of the data applications. Able to communicate the incremental business value of the personalization transformation is having on the business and client experience

Title: Application Developer
Description:
Mandatory: Java, Spring Boot
Preferred: Angular
Will be working as the technical lead for a analytics product development team comprising the product owner, project manager, 2 junior software engineers and 1 data scientist.
At least 7 years of full stack Java web application software development experience.
Able to work with the product owner to translate business requirements to technical design (e.g. class diagram, entity relation diagram).
Able to lead a team of 2 junior software engineers together with the project manager.
Knowledgeable in AngularJS and other related client side libraries.
Knowledgeable in Spring Boot and other related server side libraries for the development of technical components exposed as REST APIs.
Experience in developing enterprise applications for large scale deployment is a plus.
General appreciation of data analytics is a plus.

Title: Research Fellow
Company: Duke NUS graduate medical school Singapore
Description:
The Cancer and Stem Cell Biology (CSCB) Programme studies the causes and treatments of cancer and related diseases. The CSCB research groups have diverse programmes in both basic cancer biology and clinical-translational studies, with a special emphasis on cancers that affect the Asian community in general.


We are seeking a computational biology Research Fellow / Senior Research Fellow to assist in uncovering the genetic basis of cancer biology so as to develop the next-generation molecular diagnostics for early cancer detection. The successful candidate will work with genomics data generated from cutting-edge technologies such as single-cell genomics and liquid biopsies. This role would provide a unique opportunity to apply expertise in computational biology and machine learning towards developing new bioinformatics pipelines and algorithms through multi-omics data integration.

Develop, deploy and maintain bioinformatics workflows to process large volumes of heterogeneous genomics data such as single-cell profiling, exome/genome/transcriptome sequencing, etc.
Analyse genomics data to obtain insights on the human cancer landscape at various levels ranging from bulk tumours to the single-cell level.
Develop machine learning models to predict risk of cancer development and cancer progression, and provide personalised, molecularly-driven therapeutic recommendations.
Collaborate with clinicians and scientists by contributing bioinformatics expertise.
Liaise with IT professionals to ensure secured storage of the generated genomics data.
Perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein.

Qualifications

Job Requirements
PhD in a computing or biology related field such as Bioinformatics, Computer Science, Statistics, Computational Biology and Genetics.
Strong programming skills in R and/or Python, and have prior experience with tools such as RStudio and Jupyter.
Possess experience with the next generation sequencing data analysis such as whole-exome/whole-genome sequencing, RNA-seq, scRNA-seq and MethylSeq, especially for human cancers.
Have prior experience with machine learning and statistical modelling on heterogeneous genomics datasets.
Prior track record of peer-reviewed publications in relevant areas would be advanatageous.
Demonstrate excellent communication, technical independence, analytical and problem solving skills.
A team player who is able to prioritise, multi-task and work collaboratively in a diverse workforce.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
